The Axis seeks to gain time and preserve Italy as an Axis partner, the Allies to open the Mediterranean sea to Allied shipping and prepare to invade Europe."

name: Anvil-Dragoon
description: Anvil-Dragoon is an upcoming game from LPD Games' Campaigns of the Second World War series. From LPD's website: "Allied invasion of South France, August 1944. The Germans must deny the Allies the great ports of Marseilles and Toulon and preserve their far flung garrisons. The Allies must conduct a campaign of mobile maneuver, link up with Patton's Third Army, while opening up vital supply lines. Time is the enemy of each side in this fast paced campaign."

name: Operation Merkur: Crete, 1941
description:
A minigame of the final episode of Hitler's Balkans Campaign. Plan and execute an island invasion against the Royal Navy and some of the Commonwealth's finest soldiers. Or hold Crete against the cream of the Luftwaffe. An intricate puzzle for each side. This is the deluxe version of the game featured in Winter Special Operations.

(from LPD's website)

name: Battles for the Heartland
description: Battles for the Heartland is an upcoming game in LPD Games' Battles of the American Civil War series. According to LPD's website it, "Explores early war battles that shaped the Army of Tennessee: Mill Springs, Perryville & Stones' River. This bundle extends the BACW system by elaborating on command relationships and initiative, and by incorporating the effects of Acoustical Shadow. Mill Springs and Perryville are regimental level, Stones' River brigade level."

name: Maryland, My Maryland 1862
description: Maryland, My Maryland is an upcoming game in LPD Games' Battles of the American Civil War series. From LPD's website: "Antietam represented the best opportunity for the Army of the Potomac to win the war at one blow. Major General George B. McClellan's command style was an important part of why this did not occur. Once again, BACW's command and initiative system has to pick up the slack, allowing the Federal player some control of the battle while showing just how the Little Mac's dysfunctional command style prevented complete victory. The Confederate player faces Lee's greatest challenge - winning against 2:1 odds. Includes South Mountain, the precursor to Antietam, and Harper's Ferry, a classic race against time for divergent objectives."

name: Battle Before Westport
description: Battle Before Westport is an upcoming game in LPD Games' Battles of the American Civil War series. According to LPD's website, "This three-day battle (Oct 21-23, 1864) is a mini-campaign of the largest battle west of the Mississippi. Five cavalry Divisions (2 Federal, 3 Rebel) and the Kansas State Militia maneuver over the heart of modern Kansas City. Battle of Westport uses the command system from Battles for the Heartland, untried Kansas Militia and Confederate conscript regiments. These prairie fights are very different from more familiar eastern combats."

name: 18Xpress
description:
18xx in 90 minutes? Yes!

18Xpress delivers the feel of a middle-weight 18xx game in just 90 minutes.

18Xpress features a streamlined network building and income system that significantly reduces the playing time of a typical 18xx game without sacrificing the core aspects of the system. This luckless game was inspired by the simplicity of Railways of England and Wales, 1889, and the Historic Railroads System by Winsome Games.

A special thanks goes out to Isaac Bickerstaff for generously providing the name of the game during the Print & Play Dice Game Contest.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: America the Beautiful: American Art from the White House
description:
This is 4 games in 1 box, all relating to 36 famous artists and their artworks which hang in the White House.

The four games which can be played with the two sets of 36 tiles with images from he paintings are:

Memory: 2 or more players; using 72 cards and standard rules.

Go Collecting: 4 or more players; a memory and recognition game where the winner ends up holding the most numbers of pairs which are earned by hand management and visual identification.

Name The Painting: 2 or more players; a flashcards-type game where one player holds up the 36 cards one at a time, and the players are expected to identify the artist and title of the work. The winner is the player with the most cards at game end.

Bingo: 2 to 4 players; using cards and the master sheet with detailed info about the paintings (each column has a number 1-4) and a die. The die is rolled to determine which columns belong to which players, and players take turn trying to pick a random card from one of 6 stacks of 12 and matching it with a painting in that column. If there is a match, the player places the tile in that column atop the painting face down. If the drawn tile is not a match, it is returned to the bottom of the same stack. The winner is the first to complete his or her column.

name: Million Dollar Seller
description:
A card game where as a player, or team of players strive to sell a million dollars worth of house listings. Players can draw cards to hinder opponents by rejecting contracts, or overpriced listings.

The rules and gameplay appear to follow a style derived from Mille Bornes, so gamers who like that card game should like this one.

name: Turfe
description:
TURFE is more than a game about horses racing. It is a game about betting in a race and show it with incredible reality. You will feel as if you were there, cheering on his horse

All players move all horses throughout the race. Luck, as in any race, it helps a lot. But bet is to know what defines the winners.


TURFE é mais que um jogo sobre corridas de cavalos. É um jogo sobre apostas numa corrida e aborda o tema com incrível realidade. Você vai se sentir como se estivesse lá, torcendo pelo seu cavalo.

Todos os jogadores movimentam todos os cavalos durante toda a corrida. Sorte, como em qualquer corrida, ajuda muito. Mas saber apostar é o que define os ganhadores.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Ecstasy: A Game for Lovers
description:
Ecstasy is a game for lovers who have forgotten the excitement of their mate. The path around the board is meant to get bring partners closer together both emotionally and physically.

Each player must pass the Preparation space and write down exactly what they want done. The game is completed when one player crosses the finish line. The winner must then have what they wrote down for the preparation space completed.
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Merry-Go-Sound
description:
"Merry-Go-Sound is a game that facilitates articulation practice on a variety of levels (word, phrase, and sentence) in an enjoyable way."

This is an educational speech therapy game.

Players move around the board while drawing cards which require them to repeat a word, phrase, or sentence at the target level desired by the therapist. The first player to successful articulate these sounds and reach the merry-go-round wins.

Designed for children ages 5 to 10 years old.

Includes a colorful board, cards, 6 plastic tokens, and a spinner.

name: Spyro Checkers
description: Spyro Checkers is a Chinese Checkers variant based on the childrens' video game The Legend of Spyro: The Eternal Night. The board is a 5x7 grid with a starting area on either side. The game pieces feature the likenesses of characters from the video game. The first player to jump his way into his opponents start area is the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: What's Your Problem
description: What's Your Problem is a childrens' game about problem solving. Players move along a path through different areas on the board such as Sad Street, Frustrated Forest, and Surprise City with the ultimate goal of reaching Happy House. Players draw cards with an illustration of a problematic situation such as having to eat food you don't like or feeling ignored. Players then describe a possible solution (there are no wrong answers) and move the number of spaces indicated on the card. There are also special spaces on the board which feature an emoticon-style face which require the player to describe the emotion represented by the face to earn an extra turn.

name: Strategy Astrology Game
description:
This is a Japanese game with some English on the box. Essentially it's a version of Roulette which also includes set collection. Players can collect the season (suits) or the twelve signs of the zodiac. The game comes with a plastic roulette wheel, plastic chips in many sizes and colors, and a chip rack.

The year of publication, 1964, is a guess based on the games shown in an ad flyer in the game which shows a Japanese version of the game Dogfight.

name: Skagaspili√∞
description: A trivia game about the town of Akranes in Iceland. The questions come in three levels of difficulty making this an easier game for younger / less knowledgable players than many trivia games.

name: El Chavo
description: Join El Chavo and his friends as you work your way through the neighborhood to reach El Chavo’s barrel. Join in El Chavo’s favorite activities and become the first to get to the end and win the game. It’s El Chavo at his best…Eso, eso, eso! Includes El Chavo game board, character pawns, ball in the barrel, catch the clock, marbles, cards and instruction.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kwiqwit
description: A game of logic for 2 players where you must guess your opponent's secret numerical code. A deduction game where the codebreaker takes turns making a limited number of guesses, using logic to deduce the codemaker's secret code.

name: Laugh Trax
description:
Play is simple, the challenge is NOT!
You laugh...you lose! At specific board locations, players stare each other down as a timer determines who will be the first to lose their composure. Neither can laugh or even grin... The first to do so loses! To increase this challenge, your opponent is staring at you wearing a pig nose or any one of the six props shown. Other players are free to talk, laugh, and attempt to sabatoge the dueling pair. As the game progresses, determination snowballs into explosive laughter that roars out of players as their twitching stomachs can hold back no more! "Victory" is relative since all of the "losers" are sore from laughing! We guarantee it! Get LAUGH TRAXtm and discover why losing is now FUN!

Includes: Game board, timer, die,
6 props, directions, and playing pieces.

name: A New World
description:
A New World is a multi-player, card-driven, area-control game, where players assume the lead of a major European nation during the XVI-XVIII centuries. Players will have to manage economy, policy, diplomacy, trade, world wide exploration, colonization, religion, warfare in the effort to achieve supremacy. A New World offers an accurate and detailed historical context, supported by more 220 game-cards: players will have to deal with historical events performing to achieve better result than the historical nations did. Europe, Mediterranean Africa and Middle Eastern Asia figure out in the game map. World wide explorations and colonizations are managed by a set of dedicated game cards. Tons of political and military leaders have been added to the game by unique game counters. The victory tracking system of the game has been built to grant an open-end of scenarios by opponent hidden factors and bonuses to be claimed at the conclusion of the campaign game.

This game design project has been abandoned in October 2010.

name: ESPN Jeopardy Attach√© Edition
description: America's favorite quiz show meets ESPN in this handsome, take-anywhere edition. Use your clicker to get control of a question in categories such as: ESPN players You Love To Hate, Ballparks & Arenas, ESPN Personalities, NFL Brothers, NBA Head Coaches and dozen more. Collect chips for each correct answer as you make you way to FINAL JEOPARDY!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Exxxtasy
description:
The game for gay men that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills.

Picture cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get you have to keep your passions in check. Otherwise you lose the game!

You'll find that finishing the game is a feat in itself. So take a deep breath, keep your cool, and let Exxxtasy add a little spice to your evenings... Enjoy the game!

includes:
1 board
4 decks of cards
1 die
1 hourglass
2 tokens
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Tantric Lovers Game
description:
Tantra is an ancient practice focusing on the art of lovemaking, blending the flow of Yin (female) and Yang (male) energy for a profound mind, body and spirit connection. The Tantric Lovers Game is an experience for the two of you to learn Tantra and achieve that "ulimate" conectedness.
Created for any loving couple (from 18 to 80), this fun and easy to play game presents basic and advanced Tantric techniques and activities enabling the two of you to expand your sensual and sexual horizons. You will appreciate each other and discover a richer, more rewarding life together, and a more gratifying emotional bonding.
For a Woman, the game enables her to feel sexually empowered, fulfilling and satisfying her needs and desires (as well as her lover's). For a Man, it provides him with tools to become multi-orgasmic and to satisfy, cherish and please his lover in intimate ways she can genuinely appreciate. For a Couple, the experience can expand or rekindle your love, intensify passion, enrich and enlighten your relationship. Did I mention prolonged, mind-blowing, sensual sex?
There are several ways to win or to lose this game, depending on the rules you have chosen. Sometimes might be better to lose, if you know what i mean!

Included in The Tantric Lovers Game:

* Instructions
* Two-sided Game Board
* 2 Glass Playing Pieces
* Timer
* Die
* Chakra Chart
* 2 oz. Raspberry Edible Lubricant

name: Stairway to Pleasure
description:
You'll find this game to be a spark to your love life. It was designed to stimulate and enhance those special moments between you and your lover. It is a way of bringing back or creating new emotions and desires you thought were gone. It's perfect for all couples, whether you're long time partners or in a new relationship. The true object of this game is to relax, drop your inhibitions and totally enjoy the love between you and your partner.

Whether given as a gift or for personal use this game in guaranteed to heat up the night. Players start at one end of the board and work their way across to the finish line. All while answering "Truth or Dear" questions or fallowing direction on the "This Could Be Embarrassing" cards. The winner of the game gets to make a Special Wish that there opponent has to fulfill immediately.

name: Exxxtasy Female
description:
The game for gay women that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills.

Picture cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get you have to keep your passions in check. Otherwise you lose the game!

You'll find that finishing the game is a feat in itself. So take a deep breath, keep your cool, and let Exxxtasy Female add a little spice to your evenings... Enjoy the game!
Be the first to reach the end and make your wish that the loser will have to make true!

includes:
1 board
4 decks of cards
1 die
1 hourglass
2 tokens

name: OPFOR: Opposing Force ‚Äì The Grunts
description:
WAR HAS BEEN DECLARED! Build your Basecamp... Assemble your troops... Devastate the OPPOSING FORCE!!!

OpFor: Opposing Force™ is a customizable strategic card game in which you take command of a modern military force.

Build your basecamp consisting of Barracks - you'll need these to deploy your Personnel to the Battlefield
Send in your Infantry and go head to head with your enemy
Use your Medics save your defeated soldiers from being removed from the Battlefield
Demoralize enemy forces by sending your Snipers to the Battlefield.
Dish out orders to your troops by using the Special Action cards to perform tactical maneuvers on your enemy, giving you the edge you need to succeed in combat
Earn rewards by completing Special Missions
It's total chaos on the Battlefield as you struggle to keep the Opposing Force at bay while ensuring the survival of your General.

Wipe out the enemy forces or kill the General to claim your victory!

The Boot Camp Boxed Edition is a starter set that includes 2 forty-five card preconstructed Skirmish Decks representing 2 Platoons. Each Platoon consists of 1 General, 12 Soldiers, 3 Medics, 1 Sniper, 15 Barracks, 10 Special Action cards and 3 Special Mission cards.

BUILD A FORCE TO BE RECKONED WITH!!! COMING SOON: OpFor: Opposing Force™ expansion packs that allow you to build a more deadly fighting force:

Supply Dumps and Motor Pools to add to your Basecamp
Weapons and Equipment for your soldiers in battle
Mechanized Infantry: powerful soldiers to add to your growing force
Battle Tanks and Field Artillery to bombard your enemy's Basecamp
Anti-tank Vehicles to get rid of those pesky enemy Tanks
Navy SEALs for those sneaky missions behind enemy lines
All new Special Action and Mission Cards
New Generals with new Special Abilities

COMING THIS FALL:

OpFor: Opposing Force™: Metal Monsters - a stand alone armored vehicle combat card game
OpFor: Opposing Force™: Flyboys - a stand alone aerial combat card game
OpFor: Opposing Force™: Deep 6 - a stand alone naval combat card game


A portion of the procedes from the sale of OPFOR will be donated to Operation Homefront, a charity that lends help and support to the families of our service men and women. If you want to get involved, go to operationhomefront.net
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Bananas in Pyjamas
description: Friendly fun and exciting game for the smallest family. Can you get Amyn, Morgan and Lulun around the game board and finish the game board before the Banana 1 and Banana 2 are attached to them? Watch out, one mistake and you start over again.

name: Karkki vai kepponen?
description: It is a dark and stormy Halloween night ... You are moving around the city to get candy, but candy eager Pumpin Head is trying to catch the Halloween-night walk on, but it is stopped by its fear of ghosts. Grumpy old man would not hold the Halloween party, so all children must stay outside. The one who gets more candy by the end and will not be caught by the Pumkin Head is the winner!

name: Syd√§n sanoo
description: Cardiac says girls have a game where you are dating. The stakes are responsible for all kinds of crazy and mad discipline issues, and select your dream boyfriend of several among the boys. Gorgeous electronic heart will tell on how well you and the boys agree with! Write the answers to your diary, and when the game ends, you get to know how the other girls were able to date and whether your dream boyfriend really the best option for you! The most match points is the winner!

name: Cubes √† Jouer: Je saute et je prends
description:
This is an roll dice race game. First player plays a cricket, the second player play a toucan (that will capture the cricket if he arrives on a case where the cricket is), the third player plays a monkey (that will eat the toucan if he arrives on it) and so on. Note that when there are less than 6 players, a player may choose to play with the first unstarted animal to have two or more animals
The player who brings the cricket (may be after having eated it or even having eaten some animal that did eat the cricket) to the final square wins the game

name: Flotilla
description:
FLOTILLA is an innovative wargame system which combines board game organisation with the visual appeal of scale miniatures. The initial boxed set contains comprehensive rules for naval and air combat in the WWII era, but the system is designed to encompass integrated land combat and adapt to any historical period, facilitating play at strategic, tactical and skirmish level.

The system will be expanded by additional modules which are in preparation.
FLOTILLA Wargame System.

Website http://www.clydeside-flotilla.com/

name: Boxum Animal Zoo
description:
"This new game will teach the alphabet and increase the ability to make decisions."

Players use a spinner to match letters contained in animal names (example: B=Bear) to box in all of the letters on the gameboard.

Includes 4 alphabet game boards, 4 sets of zoo cards, 4 sets of pegs, 1 animal zoo game board, dice, and rules.

Designed for children ages 3 to 10.

name: Race Roulette
description:
Race Roulette is a horseracing game. Horses are moved by a roulette. This roulette indicates what horse can move (color) and how far it runs (numbers).
Like in normal horseracing, every player chooses 1, 2 or 3 horses to play with. When all the horses of a player arrived, that players wins.

Multiplayer-version of the game: every player chooses a unique combination of two/three horses. The player with the right combination/tiercé wins the game.

name: System Vector:  Breakdown of Mass
description:
The Breakdown of Mass is the next installment for System Vector, which is becoming a favorite game of mine in general.
The expansion does not focus much on a large amount of new units or system cards. Instead, it adds more depth to the game it's self by adding more elements to game play and strategy. The expansion includes 6 new high-resource system cards, a Black Hole system, and an Unknown system.
In addition to these, the game also features a new building aspect, where you can build structures such as factories, science institutes, and mobile shipyards. Each of these structures improves different aspects of your empire, making the games focus wider and your empire larger. With these buildings also come the chance to research and develop new technology and advancements in your empire. There will be a military technology tier, and an economical technology tier. These tiers will have 2 options per level of advancement. This will give players 4 Research Management Cards and 48 Research counters (12 for each player).

That makes 13 new cards to print out, which at 25 cents a print, comes to $3.25.

8 System cards (including the Black Hole and Unknown System)
4 Research Management cards
1 Research Counters sheet

I am really excited to be getting another System Vector game off the ground. I am lucky to be able to pop things like this out within a couple of days, while still being able to test play Armed Legion AND learn/play RftG. fun fun.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: Space War I.: The Burning Stars
description:
Space War is a fast playing Space Combat and Strategy Game. Two Players (in the Basic Version and up to 12 in the extended Versions) You have the Choice to conquer the Space, to travel with their Ships in the Hyperspace and Attack the Enemy wherever they can. Building of Ships, Bases and Conquering Planets with Landing Troops, is the Target of the Game. But to Attack your Enemies Planets you must defeat the Fleets of his Force first. The winner is who has cleared the Space from its Enemy... But be Carefull your Fleets didnt come exactley where you have sent it every time...

German Description:
Space War ist ein schnell spielbares Weltraumkampf und -strategiespiel für 2 bis 12 Spieler (Basisversion nur 2 Spieler).
Ihr habt die Wahl den Weltraum zu erobern! Eure Schiffe reisen durch den Hyperraum und greifen den Feind an wo immer Sie Ihn finden. Mächtige Sternenschiffe und Basen bauen, und die feindlichen Planeten mit Landungstruppen zu überrennen ist das Ziel. Doch um das zu erreichen müsst Ihr zuerst die Flotten der gegnersichen streitmächte schlagen. Der Sieger ist jener Spieler welcher zuerst die Galaxis von seinen Feinden gesäubert hat...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Space War II.: The Road to Karaganda
description:
German Description:
Der Rat der Confederate Stars Administration (C.S.A.) gibt bekannt:
Um die Streitigkeiten wegen des, äußerst rohstoffreichen, Sonnensystems
KARAGANDA zu beenden findet ein Wettrennen dorthin statt. Jenes Sternenreich
welches zuerst einen von intelligenten Lebewesen bewohnten Planeten in das
umstrittene Sonnensystem bringt hat das Rennen gewonnen. Das Bombardement
der Planeten von Mitbewerbern ist verboten und wird mit Ausschluß aus dem
galaktischen Rat bestraft. Planeten von Mitbewerbern können jedoch erobert
werden wenn der eigene Planet durch Unfall oder Eroberung verlorengegangen ist.
Alle Planeten beginnen das Rennen am gleichen Tag.

Der Weg nach Karaganda... ist ein Weltraumstrategiespiel für 2 - 8 Spieler ab 12 Jahren.
Im Gegensatz zu "die brennenden Sterne" Wird Karaganda als Geschwaderkampf basierendes System gespielt. Natürlich können, alternativ auch die Raumgefechtsregeln davon verwendet werden!
Ihr müßt eure Welt ins Zentrum des Sektors, zum Karaganda
Sonnensystem bringen. Dabei sind verschiedene Hindernisse, wie Schwarze Löcher, Minenfelder, Asteroidenfelder, Dunkelwolken und Hyperstürme, zu überwinden.
Außerdem sind da noch eure Mitspieler die euch die Hölle heiß machen wo sie nur
können...

English Description:
The Council from the "Confederate Stars Administration" (C.S.A.) announces: To End The disputes about the, extremely raw material-rich, solar system KARAGANDA, The race wich takes place there. That star realm which first places one planet inhabited from intelligent organisms, into that disputed solar system, has won. The bombardment of planets from competitors is forbidden and will be punished with exclusion from the galactic council. Planets of competitors can however conquered if the own planet by accident or conquest was lost. All planets begin the running on the same day. "The Road to Karaganda! is a space strategy game for 2 - 8 players starting from 12 years. Contrary to "The burning stars" Karaganda has a squadron fighting based system. Naturally, alternatively the space engagements rulesof the other Game can be used! You must bring your world in the center of the sector, to the Karaganda Solar system.Many Different obstacles, like black holes, Mine fields, Asteroidfields, dark clouds and hyperstorms must be overwhelmed. In addition your fellow players are making you the hell, where ever they can...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Storytelling

name: Tally Rally
description: Think Boggle with numbers, but instead of spelling out words, you're racing to put together equations. Tally Rally challenges math skills by requiring children to spot addition, subtraction, multiplication and division equations to win.

name: Pizza-Express
description:
Ein Spiel für 2 - 6 Spieler um heiße Pizzen und um ebensolche Reifen...
Mach deinen Pizza-Express zum besten in der Stadt...

English Description:
Hot Pizza and hot Wheels...
drive your Pizza-Express delivery Service to the best in the City...

The Game is Based in this early Variant (Later Variants are in the Phase of Planing) on a Hex Grid with Numbers inside like Sttlers from catan. All Players are setting there Pizza Express Central on a field with a "2" marked in the Center. The Numbers represented the Amount of Fees you must pay to the owner of the Building (Landlord?) every Round. The Starting Player rolls two dice on the random Events Table. Then he rolls for the field where the Pizza Couriers, must deliver their Pizzas. Every Player has one starting Courier. The first one is roling a Die to determine the Number of Crossing Points, his Driver could move this Turn. After this he moves his first driver as Near as Possible to a field with a Number rolled as Target field. If he reachs a crossing point adjacent to the target field he is earning the Printed Number multiplied with 100. These are the Pizza Units or PU (PE in German). But not PUs are the Target of the Game! The Victory depends on Victory Points based on Quality, Price and a Cutt throug rate of Delivery Times from the Pizza Orders.

I Personally like this Game but the realy simple Grafics of the Game had once avoided any succes on the Market. So i decided to release the Game with better Artwork in 2010 hopefully...

No English rules Available yet but in Praparation Status!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Quarreling: the card game
description:
Quarreling: the card game is a board game designed for couples and lovers to avoid their quarrels. Draw cards, play cards and count emotion points. He/She who gains the most points would win this game, but may also give u a sorry kiss.
To my love Flaw.

name: Confugo
description: Confugo (from Latin: "I take refuge") is a simple but addictive roll-and-move board game, suitable for players aged from 7 onwards. The objective is to move your pieces from one end of the board to the other whilst attacking your opponent's pieces and defending yourself.  In each move players have to decide whether to attack, defend or play safe. The winner is the first player to get all their pieces to safety.

name: Passion: Closer Together
description:
Passion is a board game designed for lover's that want to have fun and spice things up by learning more about what each other want and like. You and your lover will be entertained for hours as you challenge each other for favor cards and try to stay away from penalty cards. Each step along the way will be a sensual experience and sexual exploration. Main goal is to gather points to win. And a winner will get...well who knows!!!

Games are a fun and healthy way to change things up a bit in your sex life. Pulling one out from under the bed every now and again can turn a night of love-making into a special romantic event.

This game includes 162 cards (Challenge, Favor, and Penalty), a game board, 2 tokens, a notepad, a blindfold, 2 spin dials, and 2 pencils.

name: France Quiz Junior
description: France trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with 1500 fun questions that every child should know about the their country – music, sport, geography, nature, culture and much more

name: Pop & Rock: Fr√•gespel om svensk musik
description: An entertaining Question game where you can measure your knowledge of the English pop & rock music. You know who wrote the song "Teddy Bear Fredriksson? or who won "Idol 2006"? Contains 2400 questions and answers in six categories, text lines, songwriters, and mixed by a unique collaboration Includes also radio Vinyl 107, Classic Rock and Mix Megapol as a separate category. Collect a CD of all six categories and respond to the last issues to be the most and who can win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Norge quiz travel
description: An interesting quiz game about the Norway - now in a handy travel size edition! The game includes 600 questions divided into six categories, which are History, Culture, Science, Goegraphy, Sport and Miscellaneous.

name: Norge Quiz Junior
description: This popular trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with fun questions that every child should know about the their country – films, books, sport, fun places to visit and much more. Answer a question correctly from each category as you move around the board and try to collect tokens. The first player to collect 6 tokens wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Danmark Quizzen om dit land Junior
description: This popular trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with fun questions that every child should know about the their country – films, books, sport, fun places to visit and much more. Answer a question correctly from each category as you move around the board and try to collect tokens. The first player to collect 6 tokens wins.

name: Danmark Quizzen om dit land Junior travel
description: The game includes a total of 600 Denmark concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tina Lund World Cup
description: Do you dream about that being a horse riding beautiful Tina Lund? If so, the own game "Tina Lund World Cup", you get chance for that display your talents in the exciting game. To compete in the start of a borrowed horse and will be at collecting as many prizes together as possible, so to get your very own horse. When you do this, you should be able to compete with your own horse. Chance cards and sport questions make "Tina Lund World Cup" to a fun and active game. You also get chance for that to compete with different horses, and the better the rider, the better horse, you get points. Many of the horses are "untrained" and is the real challenge, you may be allowed to run with Tina Lund real horse Carola! Winner is the one who gets the famous Carola!

name: Lilly the Witch
description: 12 playing pieces with different symbols on front and back are laid out in 4 quartes of the playing area. One player takes the Hektor figure. The other players try to memorize the symbols (6 different). Then they close their eyes. “Hektor” flips one playing piece and the other players open their eyes again. Now they try to find out, which piece was flipped. The one who detects the piece first AND can tell which symbol is on the back, earns the piece nad will be the new “Hektor” for the next round. A new piece is laid out. To win the game, you must collect 5 pieces.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Super OVNI
description:
"The 2000 year's game"

Game similar to connect 4, but played on a diamond shaped board of 11x10. The game ends when all the board is filled an then all the lines of 4 or more are scored. The player with the higher total score wins.
Scoring:
4 in a row...1 point
5 in a row...2 points
6 in a row...3 points
etc...

El juego del año 2000

Juego similar a las 4 en raya, pero con tablero en forma de diamante de 11x10. El juego finaliza cuando se ha llenado todo el tablero y se puntúan todas las líneas de más de 4 fichas, ganando el jugador que más puntuación total ha conseguido.

La forma de puntuar es la siguiente:
4 en línea... 1 punto
5 en línea....2 puntos
6 en linea....3 puntos
etc.

name: Asalto Espacial
description:
Based in the Asalto game, but using two joined boards. The players are attackers and defenders at the same time.

The objective of the game is to occupy the 9 spaces that defended the other player, or the destruction of his attack spaceships, or the immobilization of his deffense spaceships. In each turn the player can move an attack or deffense ship. The defense ships can move in all directions. Attack ships are limited to advance by the blue lines, not being able to use the green ones. The movement is realised square by square. The deffense ships can also eliminate the attacking ones like checkers. If they dont't do it then the deffense ship is retired from the board temporaly. A player can get back a deffense ship when he conquer a square of the last free line with his attack ship.


"Ataque y defensa con naves interplanetarias"Juego basado en el juego del Asalto, pero en el que se han unido dos tableros y los jugadores han de ser tanto atacantes como defensores.

El objetivo del juego es ocupar los 9 espacios que defendidos por el contrario, o por la destrucción sus naves de ataque, o la inmobilización de sus naves de defensa.

En cada turno el jugador podrá mover una nave de ataque o una de defensa. Las naves de defensa pueden mover en todas direcciones, mientras que las de ataque están limitadas a avanzar por las lineas azules, no pudiendo usar las verdes. El movimiento se realiza casilla a casilla, menos cuando una nave de defensa puede eliminar una nave atacante, haciéndolo como el el juego de las damas. Al igual que las damas el comer es obligatorio y si no se lleva a cabo la nave defensora puede ser "soplada". Las naves "sopladas" pueden reintegrarse al juego desde el centro del tablero si se ha conquistado alguna casilla de la última línea libre.

name: Klotrix Trivia
description: Klotrix Trivia is a promotional product for the Potassium Suppliment Klotrix. The game features general knowledge trivia questions and a special board with a track modeled after the patented fast release of Klotrix. On certain squares, players are allowed to answer an additional question to skip ahead on the track. The winner is the first person to make it back to their starting area.

name: Med D√∂derhultarn p√• v√§rldsomsegling till Bl√• Jungfrun
description:
"Döderhultarn" is the colloquial name for a Swedish artist (woodcarver) called Axel Petersson (1868-1925). "Blå Jungfrun" ("The Blue Maiden") is a small island outside of Sweden which is a nature reserve since 1926. Apparently Döderhultarn was a bit excentric, and also very fond of the island. This game tries to encompass all this in a story of how he travels all over the world before actually reaching Blå Jungfrun.

The game consists of a single sheet of paper, 76 x 54 cm, folded twice to create a thin booklet. Each space the players move through has a small illustration and a short verse, describing what happens.

The game is published to benefit "Svenska typografförbundets invalid- och tuberkulosfonder", the Swedish typographer union's invalid and tuberculosis funds.

name: Class Clown
description:
From the game envelope: "In Class Clown players take turns as the teacher of an unruly class. When you are not the teacher, you want to be as far away from her as possible so that you can get into the most trouble"

Contents: 24 numbered cards (1-6 in 4 colors), 4 Class Clown cards and 1 rule sheet. Also has 4 advertisement cards.

One d6 and a way to keep score are also needed.

name: Monster House
description:
Epidemic pits two players controlling a group of friends against a third player who controls a monster.

From the site:
"It's the middle of the night and you and your friends in a haunted house. You are trapped inside and your only way out is by killing the monster before he kills you."

name: Baa Baa Moo
description:
From the designer's Etsy listing (Etsy seller fun4thecar):

I created this card game for younger children, but when different people started playing with them, we found out that teenagers and adults laughed uncontrollably as they tried to shout out the right animal sounds!

This game is made out of laminated paper (with rounded corners). Rules: Cards are placed down one at a time. Two players see who can make the correct animal sound first. The person who makes the correct sound first, holds on to the card. When the rabbit card appears - don't make a sound! If you do - you lose one of your cards. It helps to have a judge, too, to determine who shouts out the right sound first. Whoever ends up with the most cards in the end wins.

name: The Quintana Game
description:
This game is aimed at recreating the events celebrated in The Quintana, held in Ascoli Piceno in Le Marche, Italy on the first Sunday in August. This pageant remembers the political in-fighting that raged in the town during the early Renaissance.

Up to 6 factions struggle to provide the best jouster to claim the rights as the top faction for the coming year.

This is a roll and move game where you have to occasionally answer trivia questions about the Quintana. There isn't much for gamers here but, for those who've seen the Qunitana, it is an evocative rendition of the events in game form with all the components coloured according to the flags of the 6 factions.

name: Chytr√Ω zaj√≠ƒçek
description: Once upon a time bunny makes up his mind that he invites his friends for a visit. Who finds the most carrots is the winner. Game practices memory, attention and patience.

name: Kris Kros Pro Deti
description: Board game with words for children. Words you create as in crossword. For the youngest there is board game with pictures, for older children there is classical board game.

name: The Little Mole and Letters
description: Game is dedicated to small children who are just discovering the alphabet. Game contents board game with illustrations of favourite the Little Mole and his friends. Children complete simple words with firing letters onto preprinted boxes. By the firing the last letter of the word gets player chip as a point. Who has got the most points is the winner. Game practice memory, thinking, lexicon, language skills and patience.

name: Blondie Playing Card Game
description: Early 1940's card game featuring the comic strip legends. The cards feature full color cartoon scenes from the Blondie comic strip.

name: Charlie Chan Card Game
description: Late 1930's card game featuring the fictional Chinese-American detective
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Liberty Flag Game
description: 1940's card game of Flag identification and matching.

name: Mickey Mouse's Treasure Hunt
description: A food premium game issued by Post Toasties. Simple spin and move game taking you around a track that features Mickey.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Steve Allen's Qubila
description: As the name implies - this is a Word game played by rolling cubes and spelling words.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Tiddle Tower
description:
"The Snap-up Game of Lively Jumps"

1930's dexterity game of flicking jacks into containers mounted on a pole.

name: Tollroad Turnpike
description: Educational, easy to play game that featured some cool mini cars. The game is a simple spin and move around the track style of game. Game features Chevrolet, Aston Matin, Bentley and Van Wall brand cars.

name: Northern Guard Army List
description:
From the back of the book:

The Northern Guard is the main armed force of the North and leading the fight against the Southern MILICIA. It is an integrated army ready to take on all comers and hand them a resounding defeat. The pride of the North, the Guard fields a devastating combination of Gears, armor and infantry, ideal for fighting in the deserts, forest and jungles of Terra Nova.
The Northern Guard Army List provides Heavy Gear tactical Players with all the information they need to run battles featuring the Guard and build their own Guard units. Northern Guard land forces are covered in detail along with guidelines for building miniature armies, new tactical abilities for special units and some historical background on the Guard.
The Army List includes:
- Details on over 70 standard squadron types, including 27 Gear squadrons, 3 strider squadrons, 24 infantry squads and 18 armored squadrons. Each squadron includes unique tactical abilities and optional vehicle modifications.
- Rules for building your own Northern Guard regiment.
- Seven new Gear and tank variants unique to the Northern Guard.
- Full details on five famous regiment, including their commanders, special squadrons and unique tactical abilities. Each regiment is ready to play.
- Background details on the Guard, including strategy, medals, uniforms and standard equipment.

Stock Number: DP9-046
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Southern Milicia Army List
description:
From the back of the book:

MILICIA is an acronym which stands for MILitary Intervention/Counter-Insurgency Army. The Southern MILICIA recruits troops from all four Southern leagues; they are used to staff border outpost and perform counter-insurgency duty in the three vassal leagues. Most importantly, they spearhead the fighting against the South's enemies, taking the fight to protect their own across Terra Nova.
The Southern MILICIA Army List provides Heavy Gear tactical Players with all the information they need to run battles featuring the MILICIA and to buid their own MILICIA units. Southern land forces are covered in detail along with guidelines for building miniature armies, new tactical abilities for special units and some historical background on the MILICIA.
The Army List includes:
- Details on over 70 standard cadre types, including 27 Gear cadres, 3 strider cadres, 24 infantry squads and 18 armored squadrons. Each squadron includes unique tactical abilities and optional vehicle modifications.
- Rules for building your own Southern MILICIA regiment.
- New Gear and tank variants unique to the Southern MILICIA.
- Full details on five famous regiments, including their commanders, special squadrons and unique tactical abilities. Ech regiment is ready to play.
- Background details on the MILICIA, including strategy, medals, uniforms and standard equipment.

Stock number: DP9-048.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Pop-A-Word
description:
Pop-A-Word is a word-forming dice game, self-contained in the familiar Kohner Pop-O-Matic mechanism.

On a player's turn, the tray containing nine letter cubes is popped and jiggled until lying flat in the center. The player then makes the highest-scoring word possible from the letters showing face-up, the score being the total of the point values on the letters used in the word. Letters cannot be used multiple times unless showing on multiple faces, and a blank can be used for any letter, though that letter scores 0. Bonuses of an extra turn and extra points are earned for words of 6 to 9 letters. The game continues until a player reaches 200 points or some other agreed-upon total.

There is an alternate game where all players form his or her own word simultaneously from the same pop.

name: The New Linkage
description:
An innovative card game that breaks the conventional pattern of numbers and alphabets. the new Linkage links up the color dots with its own unique game theory. The game is developed to suit players of different ages and at different levels.

The new Linkage brings fun and join to everyone. And the game "Links" up your relationship with your friends and your family. Try the new Linkage -- you will like it!

The game contain 108 cards (in 3 colors form 1 to 9 and 4 cards each), and 5 different games
"Lucky Draw"
"Never - mind"
"Consective Linkage"
"Suvivor"
"Pairing & Linking"

The basic linking principle is that, two card can be link in two ways,
1- cards with same number but different color
2- cards with same color with continue number e.g. 1 and 2, 7 and 8

name: En Route Game
description:
This game features a map of Europe across which players travel via train and sea. They have a number of sea tickets, rail passes, and passports with which to complete the task.

Year published, 1920, is just a guess.

name: Shantu
description:
Shan Tu is a combination of Halma and Checkers that features a three-cornered board made up of a grid of circles, each connected with up to six adjacent circles. (The board could easily be drawn with hexagons instead of circles and lines.) The game is meant for three players but can be played by two. Its pieces (ten per player) begin in one corner and move to an opponent's starting corner to be crowned, then must move to one of three central circles in order to win the game. The first player to get one king to the central circles wins. Pieces, be they ordinary un-promoted pieces or Kings, may move in any direction and capture opposing pieces by jumping. Kings have no advantage other than that they are required to win the game.

According to The International Society for Board Game Studies, Shan Tu dates back at least to an 1895 advertisement describing it as "A worthy successor to Gobang, Reversi, Halma and other favourites."
publishers: (Public Domain), John Jaques of London, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Kampf um die Sterne
description:
English Description:
"Fight for the Stars" depends on its, first 1986 finnished predecessor "Space War".
This Space Based Battle and Strategygame, let the Players send their Fleets in Epic Space Battles. But the Administration and Structuring of your Empire would be same important as Battletactics. Building new colonies, design Starships and Collecting new Benefits of Technology are only a Handfull of the Possibillities from the Game. Refight the epic Historical Battles of the "First Terra" and and determine the Future of the Earth und from their Allies as well as from their enemies....

"The first Scoutships returned from its long, adventurous journeys. They report of new, unexplored worlds. At the same time they also told, that outside, between the stars, the terrible Fury of the war is ruling the Stars. A young empire stands in the fight against five allies, with one another star realms. Both sides look for worlds, which they can exploit them either, or allied it to their Star Realms. Without the want of mankind they are thrown into the swirling maelstrom. Thus begins then for mankind the "FIGHT FOR THE STARS"...

Historical Scenarios:
A. "Against all odds"
B. "Cry for Freedom"
C. "Slavehunters"
D. "The burning Skies"
E. "Target: EARTH"
F. "The Hand of Faith..."
G. "The Two Crosses"
I. "Fight for the Earth"
H. "Dolchstoß..." (Knife impact?)
J. "Changing the Frontiers"
K. "Descent to Hell"
L. "Jump in the Fire"

The Time Scedule for the History, from 2051 up to 2200 will be added soon as possible...

German Description: Kampf um die Sterne beruht auf dem erstmals 1986 fertiggestellten Vorläufer Space War. Bei dem Weltraumkampf und Strategiespiel Schicken die Spieler Ihre Flotten in epische Weltraumschlachten. Doch der Aufbau und die Verwaltung eures Sternenreiches sollte euch ebenso beanspruchen wie die Kampftaktik. Kolonien gründen, Raumschiffe entwerfen und die Technologie weiterentwickeln sind nur wenige der vielen Möglichkeiten des Spiels. In epischen "historischen" Gefechten kann die Zukunft der Erde und ihrer Verbündeten bestimmt werden.

"Die ersten Scoutschiffe sind von ihren langen, abenteuerlichen Reisen zurückgekehrt. Sie berichten von neuen, unerforschten Welten. Gleichzeitig verbreiten sie auch die Kunde, daß draußen, zwischen den Sternen, die schreckliche Furie des Krieges tobt.

Ein junges Imperium steht im Kampf gegen fünf miteinander verbündete Sternenreiche. Beide Seiten suchen Welten die sie entweder ausbeuten oder zu Verbündeten machen können.

Ohne daß die Menschheit es wollte wird auch sie in den Strudel des Verderbens hineingerissen.

So beginnt dann für die Menschheit der

KAMPF UM DIE STERNE

A. Das Basisspiel

KAMPF UM DIE STERNE ist ein Spiel für maximal sieben Personen ab 12 Jahren. Ziel des Spieles ist es entweder, nach einer vorher ausgemachten Anzahl von Spielrunden, die meisten Sonnensysteme (Variante A) oder mehr als die Hälfte aller Welten dieses Sternensektors (Variante B), zu beherrschen.

Alternativ können die Szenarien der Hintergrundgeschichte gespielt werden. Näheres dazu im Anhang (E).

3. Die Szenarien

A. "Gegen jede Chance"
B. "Schrei nach Freiheit"
C. "Sklavenjäger"
D. "Der brennende Himmel"
E. "Ziel: ERDE"
F. "Die Hand des Schicksals..."
G. "Die zwei Kreuze"
I. "Kampf um die Erde"
H. "Dolchstoß..."
J. "Frontenwechsel"
K. "Abstieg zur Hölle"
L. "Sprung ins Feuer"

2. Zeittafel

2051
Fünf Sternenvölker beherschen den, die Erde umgebenden, Raumsektor. Sie herrschen durch ihre Wirtschaftsmacht und mit Waffengewalt. Eine einzige unterdrückte, ausgebeutete Welt wagt sich zu wiedersetzen. Ihre einzigen Raumschiffe sind kleine wendige Raumjäger. Ihr Kampf ist "Gegen jede Chance".

2052 - 2082
Ein "Schrei nach Freiheit" breitet sich über die Welten des Sektors aus. Eine unterdrückte Welt nach der anderen schließt sich den Rebellen an. Diese Welten gründen die Konföderation von Konquerein.

2061
Die fünf Sternenmächte gründen eine Allianz um gemeinsam gegen die Rebellen vorzugehen.

2097
nachdem mehr als 1.500.000 Menschen von allierten Sklavenjägern entführt worden sind wird endlich eine wirkliche Weltföderation gegründet. Beginn der Aufstellung einer Strategischen Raumflotte unter dem neugegründeten Strategischen Raumverteidigungskommando.

2098
Die "Sklavenjäger" fallen massiv ins Solarsystem ein. Die Terranische Raumflotte wird in erste verlustreiche Kämpfe verwickelt.

2111
Gründung des Interstellaren Terranischen Scoutdienstes (ISTS).

2113
Das erste Terranische Scoutschiff, die Magellan, bricht zu ihrer langen Reise nach Barnards Stern auf.
Ihre Schwesterschiffe, die Columbus und die Vasco da Gama, brechen nur wenige Wochen später, nach Alpha Centauri und Proxima Centauri, auf.

2127
Barnards Stern wird durch eine unbekannte Waffe zur Supernova. Die Magellan entkommt da sie von einem, Zeitfeld in die Vergangenheit geschleudert wird.

2131
Die Columbus kehrt als erstes Terranisches Scoutschif, von ihrer Reise zum Alpha Centauri, zurück.
Rückkehr der Magellan.

2137
Das erste Terranische Raumschiff mit Hyperraumantrieb, die Sindbad, startet zu ihrer abenteuerlichen Reise.

2159
Erster Angriff, durch eine Velkandrische Flotte, auf die Erde. Gleichzeitig erreicht die Plasmastoßdruckwelle der Barnardsstern Supernova die Erde. "Der brennende Himmel" wird zum Fanal einer neuen Epoche.

2160
Eine Velkandrische Flotte ist unterwegs das "Ziel ERDE" zu erobern. Die beinahe unverteidigte Erde wird erobert.

2161
"Die Hand des Schicksals" führt Henry St. George, einen von allierten Sklavenjägern entführten Terraner nach Konquerein. Er wird vom Rat von Konquerein mit der Aufgabe betraut der Erde ein Bündnis anzutragen. Die legendäre siebte Flotte von Konquerein stößt zur Erde vor und befreit sie von den Vilarii.
Unter der Führung von Henry St. George wird Terra zum Verbündeten von Konquerein. "Die zwei Kreuze" von Konquerein und der Erde kämpfen nun gemeinsam gegen die Allianz.

2176
Der "Dolchstoß" des 1. Lordadmirals beendet die Konföderation und hebt in blutigen Kämpfen das Imperium von Konquerein aus der Taufe.

2179
Von Henry St. George selbst vorbereitet wird durch den Scoutdienst die Terranische Revolution ausgelöst und der "Kampf um die Erde" beginnt.
Es kommt zum "Frontenwechsel" bei dem die Erde sich der Allianz anschließt.

2199
Die Völker sind des endlosen Krieges müde geworden. Die Allierten starten eine letzte Großoffensive um endlich den Sieg zu erringen. Es wird ein "Abstieg zur Hölle".

2200
Die Terranische Flotte startet einen letzten verzweifelten Angriff auf das Heimatsystem Konquerein. Die gesamten Streitkräfte der Allianz unternehmen mit allen Einheiten Ablenkungsangriffe entlang der ganzen Front. Es ist ein "Sprung ins Feuer" denn die Aussichten, der Terranischen Flotte, zu siegen scheinen unendlich gering. Doch die Terraner geben sich nicht geschlagen. Denn sie haben noch einen letzten Trumpf in der Hand...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: G√∂tter, Helden, Opferl√§mmer...
description:
English Description:
The Game is Made for up to 8 Players.
Quadratic Game Tiles represent the Landscape similar to Kings and Things and other Games of this Kind. Villages, Cities, a Main City, Castle, mines and more are Markings of the Realms from the Players. But also Battles will be there. Knights and Heroes, Farmers and shepherds must be recruited, to steal your enemies Sheep... only with enough victim Lambs you can correct benevolent the Gods and shaping new Land... make magic rites and defeat the evil... maybe you can be victorious against your enemies or even the Mighty common Sheep demons... Collect Food and breed Sheep... a structural building Strategy game from a little other kind...

German Description: Das Spiel ist für bis zu 8 Spieler gedacht. viereckicke Geländeteile ähnlich wie bei Kings and Things oder siedler von Catan stellen die Landschaft dar. Auf dieser Landschaft haben die Spieler Ihre Reiche mit Dörfern, Städten, Burgen usw... Doch auch Kampf gibt es zu oft... Ritter und Helden Bauern und Hirten werden aufgeboten um dem Gegner die Schaafe zu stehlen... denn nur mit genügend Opferlämmern kannst du deine Götter gnädig stimmen und neues Land schaffen... Zauber wirken... und dem Bösen begegnen... ja sogar vielleicht die gemeinen Schaafsdämonen besiegen... Nahrung sammeln und Schaafe züchten... ein Aufbaustrategiespiel der etwas anderen Art...

No English Rules available at present time!
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Exploration, Fantasy, Farming, Humor
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: SCORE!
description:
From the designer's Etsy listing (Etsy seller fun4thecar):

"This is a travel game I created after many trips with my nieces and members of our youth group. Simply roll the colored die. Match the color rolled on the die to the color on the chart and begin your search! Whoever finds the correct number of items first wins the round. Don't forget to shout "Score!" as you spot items along the road."

Laminated 3-1/2 x 5-3/4 card printed with the color-coded chart indicating the items you're looking for (ex: 4 yellow cars) and two scoring tracks. Comes in a ziplock with 2 tiny clothes pins to track your score on the scoring track and a custom D6.

name: Bob the Builder: Tricky Tool Box
description: This fun action game is great for children 3 plus. Bob's toolbox spins around opening and closing as it goes and the players have to flick all of their coloured tools into the box first to be the winner. Be quick though as the tricky little toolbox keeps throwing them back out! Great fun for upto 4 people.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hershey's Kisses Counting Game
description: Players move their tokens around a board decorated with Hershey's candies in an effort to collect enough candies to win the game. No decision-making is involved.

name: Battlefields of Olympus: Campaigns of Glory
description:
Expansion for the 2008 release of Battlefields of Olympus.

Campaigns of Glory introduces Campaigns and Mythological Weapons to the battlefield. In addition, there will be more Land Trophies, Actions and Warrior cards.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Guess the Gargoyle
description:
Object: To be the first player to get his/her gargoyle across the finish line.

Gameplay: Since the identity of gargoyles is hidden, you may be advancing another player's gargoyle. The game board includes SWITCH spaces, LOOK spaces, and LOOK 'N SWITCH spaces.

Box Contents: Board, 4 identical plastic gargoyle figures with different colored dots on bottom of base, 1 d6, instructions.

name: Lepanto 1571
description:
The simulation is designed for two players, one with a Muslim fleet and one with a Christian fleet.
Both players should be aware that although they primarily represent admirals with dreams of defeating the whole enemy fleet, they also represent subordinate officers who have personal objectives. They must allow for the wishes of individual captains to seek plunder on wrecked ships before their rivals get to it.

name: ChessCraft
description:
In the World of ChessCraft, there are 4 races. Each race represented by a different colour. Orc is Red, Undead is Black, Human is Blue and Elf is Green. Each has their own unique abilities to influence the game play. Orc has piece promotion and piece destruction. Undead has graveyard manipulation and piece control. Human has piece position and board manipulation. Elf has card manipulation. The battle has just began!

ChessCraft is an abstract game played with cards, for 1 vs 1 or 2 vs 2 players. Each game takes around 30 min to 1 hr. Contents of the full games are:
a) 32 pieces
b) 75 cards
c) 16 board tiles

The objectives of the game are
(1) Capture the opponent king
(2) Accumulate 20 or more cards per player
(3) When the king reaches the opponent’s summoning board tile

Players take turns to place the board tiles. At the beginning of each player's turn, he draws 1 card from a common draw pile. During his turn, the player has to make a move on one of his pieces. At any time during his turn, he can
(1) Summon basic or advanced pieces
(2) Promote basic pieces to advanced pieces
(3) Play cards

To do these 3 actions, costs must be paid first, which means discarding cards equal to the cost face down to a common discard pile. Whenever a card is played, the opponent may respond by playing a card. Cards are resolved first in last out. During opponent's turn, player may also play cards. Player can also modify the movement, capture or interaction with opposing piece of a piece in play by paying the cost of a Piece Modifier Action card. The effects of the modification lasts only the turn the card is played. Unsummoned pieces are in each player’s reserve. When the pieces are captured (or destroyed), they are placed in each player’s graveyard.

There are 2 types of cards. Actions go to the discard pile face up immediately while Permanents stay in play in front of the player who played them. Kings cannot be targeted or affected by cards unless specified. Player may not Check the opponent if he plays any card prior to his Move.

Each 2x2 board tile has a coloured circle in one of the squares. The circle indicates the square as a terrain of that colour. At the beginning of a player’s turn, if his pieces occupy all 4 terrains of his own colour, he can draw 1 more card.

Discussion forum can be found here
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/3869101#3869101
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Electronic Sound Snap
description:
It's snap with a twist, don't match the pairs but listen to the sound and then snap a card that matches.

Includes songs, sounds and characters from 6 hit shows: Thomas and friends, Bob the builder, Pingu, Barney, Angelina Ballerina and Fireman Sam.

The cards containing pictures of favourite characters are spread evenly across the floor. Children then use sticks (or fly swats is a better term) with rubber suckers on the end to pick up the cards when they hear the relevant characters theme tune or catch phrases.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: MagiFlux
description:
MagiFlux is a card game for 2-4 players. The inspiration for this game came from Fluxx and Magic:The Gathering.

Objective of the game is to be the first to have cards in play that have a total of 10 Victory Points.

At the beginning of each turn, a player takes the top card from his own library, and untaps all resources. During each turn, a player may play 1 card face down as a resource. Resources and cards played remain in play.To play a card, pay by tapping the number of resources equal to its cost. Each card's cost is also worth the same amount of Victory Points.

Player may activate the abilities on his cards in play. Ability costs must be paid or triggered before the ability is resolved. Costs are usually related to player's own cards. A player is out of the game if he has no cards in his library.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Print & Play

name: Card Race
description:
Full of pep.
Not much is known about this antique bcard game. The box contents a board to mark a score. You're supposed to use a own deck of cards.

name: Stripster
description: A variation on Twister and stripping. Players spin and either put a hand or foot on the mat - or they are forced to remove clothing.

name: Undersea Warriors
description:
From the introduction:

"Undersea Warriors is a game of tactical combat between U-boat, or Submarine, and Destroyer, or anti-Submarine vessel. These are essentially non-nuclear "type" vessels, reflecting hypothetical combat which could be all the way from the middle of World War II, to the 1960's."

The game appears to have come in a large ziplock bag with the following components:
- Rule Book (139 pages with additional charts in back).
- Map (A large hex map with a coordinate system running down two edges)
- 12 Submarine/Counter sheets (Each heavy paper sheet is identical and has two basic elements: 1. An area to cut out counters for ships, torpedoes, etc.; and 2. Player sheets to track damage, etc., on two different, and somewhat odd looking, submarines.

name: Piranha Attacke
description: Roll a colour die and then use your piranha to try to catch the correct coloured fish. Catching the wrong coloured fish gives a penalty.

name: Pyramida
description:
TURNS
At each turn, each player moves a friendly stone.:
Stones move to one diagonally adjacent empty cell (forward or backward).
A stone is removed if it reaches the pyramid top (cell k14).

ATTACKS
There are no captures, but enemy stones can be delayed in two ways:
By contact: If a stone moves forwards to a cell adjacent to an enemy stone, then this stone moves diagonally backwards to an empty cell. If the enemy stone cannot retreat (because both cells are occupied) the actual player gets an extra move.
By column: if there are exactly one black and one white stone at a column, the higher stone can be attacked. If the other player moves one stone forward to that column, the upper stone is placed in an empty cell on the lowest row of that column (which is accessible by a sequence of moves: in a chess-like board, the game only uses black squares). If the enemy stone cannot retreat (it was at the fifth row) the current player gets an extra move.
If both attacks occur in a single move, column attacks takes precedence over contact attacks. That is, the player only executes the column retreat. If that retreat is not possible, he executes the contact retreat. If that retreat is also not possible, the player gets an extra move.

LAST STONE
If a player only has one stone, it may move one or two cells (mover's choice) and may retreat one or two cells after an attack by contact (attacker's choice).

GOAL
If a player repeats a position by the third time, he loses.

name: In-Door Baseball
description: A simple baseball simulation that determined play results by using different spinning tops.

name: Covered Wagon Trail
description: Roll and move around the track game for children which also contained another game - Steer Roping.

name: Crazy Alley
description:
"A Goofy Game with Giggles Galore"

A dexterity game involving rolling a ball down the board and avoiding or using obstacles to land into different scoring holes.

name: Katzenjammer Kids Hockey
description: A dexterity game where you flick wooden pucks into a stand up game board into various holes. Features images of the famous Katzenjammer Kids.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Sports

name: Radio Ramble
description:
A roll-and-move game in which the board is a map of the United States, with certain spaces designated with cities' radio stations. Players start from Station WEAF in New York and make a "complete circuit" around the country.

The game features an unusual mechanism for movement. Instead of a die or spinner, players use a "radio tuner" with two turning card discs. Shutter windows in the tuner reveal a station call sign (like WEAF) on one side and a number on the other. Players look up the station on the back of the tuner, where it is associated with a numerical value; that value is then added to the number revealed on the front. Therefore, if a player "tunes in" to Station WMC (Memphis), and the number 3, they then look on the back to see that WEC has a value of 1. That player then moves 3+1 spaces on the board.

If players land on the same station they "tuned in" on their turn, they get a free extra turn. Players must "tune in" an exact number of spaces to finish their route and end on WEAF back in New York.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Red Ryder's 3 Game Set
description:
3 game set featured the following titles:

Ambushed
Desert Towns
Steer Roping

All are basic roll and move games for children.

name: Squad Car
description: Police themed game with a cool looking game board and metal cars. A spinner and some cards create different movement options. The game has 6 cars. The bank robbers have 3 getaway cars the police have 3 Squad Cars plus the police have 3 roadblocks that can be used to block 3 street exits or avenues leading off of the board. The movement of cars is regulated by a spinner and also by radio flashcards sent from Police Headwuarters to the Squad Cars. The spinner regulates movement. Spin the dila and if the arrow is yellow then spin again until the spinner points either red or green where the cop either stops or moves the indicated number of squares. If all getaway cars are captured by the Squad Cars the police have won. If just one getaway car escapes then the bank robbers have won the game.

name: What's the Answer?
description: Spin and spinner that lands on a letter of the alphabet and then draw a card that asks a question of which you need to come up with an answer that begin with the letter you've spun.

name: Seafood Express
description:
Seafood Express is a dice game for 3 to 5 seafood chefs.
Players run a hawker stall in Singapore serving delicious seafood dishes. The key to a successful business is to serve your customers as fast as you get your ingredients - that way they know they are getting only the freshest produce.

The object of the game is to gain the most points by picking the freshest seafood and serving it up to complete seafood menus. Each menu requires accompanying beverages and usually includes a vegetable dish. If you’re short of a precious ingredient you can always use a couple of coins to buy what you need.

This game was published on BGG in this thread:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/428877/page/4
The mechanics of the game are similar to that found in Seafood Express

name: Echo
description:
Echo is a LDS quiz game similar in style to Family Feud. The game comes with questions that were asked of 100 LDS church members. Players must try to give the most popular answer from that survey result. For example, for the question "Name a state other than Utah where many Latter-day Saints reside," the answers were: California (41), Idaho (32), Nevada (15), and Arizona (12). Players earn points by matching the most popular answers.

The game has rules for two players or teams.

name: Zoom The Airplane Card Game
description:
Each card in this game features a portrait of a vintage World War II airplane, the plane's name and country of origin, and a number value.
The set consists of 36 cards, 9 each of blue, red, black, and yellow, and the instructions.

This object of the game is to win all (or most) of the cards in the deck from the other players. As in the game War higher numbered cards prevail. In case of a tie, the cards go to the player who most quickly calls out "Zoom".

Players learn the names and nationalities of the warplanes from the pictures on the face of the cards in the course of playing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, World War II

name: Chantecler: The Great Card Game
description:
There are four suits, Hen, Ducks Goose, and Turkey.Each suit is numbered 1 to 10. There are four cards which are always trumps, no matter what the suit is:

Chantecler (Rooster)
Peacock
Pheasant
Owl


The persons sitting opposite are partners. Every player gets 11 cards. Each player then bids in privilege of naming the trump. The highest bidder decides the suit he/she selects for trump and all players discard down to 6 cards.
The player naming the trump then plays face up in the center of the table a card of the suit he/she has named, with as aim winning as many of the counter cards as possible.

Then the next player plays a card of the suit named. The player with the highest values takes the four cards.(called The Trick). After the first Trick is played its optional whether or not trumps are lead.

Scoring:

When the hand is finished, each side adds together the counter cards (1,3,5 and the trump cards) which they have taken and credit to their score. If a bidder fails to make as many points as he/she bid, he/she is said to be set, and the number bid is subtracted from his score. The first side scoring 56 points wins the game.

name: An Abominable Kind of War:  The Conflict for North America 1755-1761
description:
"The ferocity and insolence of these black-souled barbarians makes one shudder. It is an abominable kind of war. The air one breathes is contagious of insensibility and hardness."
-Louis Antoine, Comte de Bougainville

An Abominable Kind of War, presents the players with a juxtaposition; on the one hand, you have the stylized warfare of 18th century Europe, embodied in the Regular Infantry of the Line, and the dandified officers who were habituated to the finery of the courts of England and France, with a mentality little suited to combat in “a labyrinth of forests, without roads;” on the other, the brutal, almost feral type of warfare unleashed in North America in the form of “an invisible enemy, who strikes and vanishes, swift as the lightning…” whose “ferocity and insolence…makes[sic] one shudder.”

As the French, you must tame the “lords of the wilderness” and harness their fierce art of war without burning up too much materiel on them; though, should you allocate too little in the way of gifts and supplies for your formidable allies, they will return to their haunts in the wild, leaving your undermanned French regiments alone to face the gathering might of Great Britain and her American colonies. So, can you find the right balance between the ferocious partisan war of the wilderness and the more “civilized” style of war as practiced in Europe? If so, then perhaps the Marquis de Montcalm, with his French battalions, can stave off his more numerous enemies to the south; perhaps New France can survive the tempest of war.

As the English, you, too, have a difficult “balancing” act to master; you must find a way to placate and protect your fiercely independent, but extremely valuable Colonials. Without their numbers and forest craft, you stand little chance of besting the potent combination of “unmitigated savages” from the Lakes, Mission Indians from the St. Lawrence Valley, Canadian bush rangers, and French battalions which will be coming at you in waves. Ask too much of the Americans; do too little on their behalf; treat them with disrespect; they will turn a deaf ear to your entreaties and allow the British Regulars to march off to certain defeat out there, at the hands of a foe who is covered “by the universal forest.”

And, facing both of you, is “an immense uninhabited wilderness, overgrown everywhere with trees and brushwood, so that nowhere can one see twenty yards.” This vast, uncharted forest dominates the struggle. Ultimately, victory will only go to that player who can conquer that savage landscape stretching out before him. It is the “insidious warfare of the forest,” then, which will determine the outcome of this struggle!

name: My First Tell the Time Game
description: My First Tell the Time Game is an educational game that teaches children how to read clock faces by matching cards with clock images to various times.

name: Super Mario Brothers Adventure DX
description:
This is one of the board game version of the famous video game.
It used the story setting of the first Super Mario Brothers in 1980s.
No more cursor or "A" " B" "start" button, you use cards to the action like walk, jump, even the enemies movement.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mine Layers
description: Each player, two, take control of one mine layer truck. Players move around the combat field laying mines and pursuing the enemy. The first one to get touched by 4 mines or to get his or her engines destoyed loses the game.

name: The Champ
description: Two players take the role of a boxer each. Choose your actions and defeat your opponent! Uppercut, jab, blocking? Will you be eliminated? Fight your way to become The Champ!

name: Auction Guru
description: Bid and buy in order to earn the most wealth. But be careful, your opponents might trick you and make you waste your money! Buy hotels, cars, clubs or factories and become the wealthiest Auction Guru. Will you be the smartest buyer?

name: Match Makers
description:
Match Makers - an abstract game dripping with theme.

In this two-player card game the competitors try to lead promising couples from first love through engagement to a happy wedding. You will be
- drawing characters from the character deck,
- forming new enamored couples,
- strengthening the relationship of your couples through engagement or marriage and
- seducing your opponent's characters.

Couples that have many common interests are less vulnerable to seduction, but will also earn less points in the final scoring.

Friends of tile laying games will enjoy the hunt for every opportunity to break up opposing twosomes. A good timing of the available actions - combined with swift adaption to the rule changes triggered by the marriage licenses - is the key to success. You can play on the safe side, but should definitely take some risk when your opponent has a limited hand.

More information at http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/match-makers

name: Off With Their Heads!
description:
In this humorous game set in the world of Lewis Carroll's "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland" and its sequel "Through the Looking-Glass", players attempt to collect the characters from the stories by following the command of the Queen of Hearts: "Off With Their Heads!"

Using a line-up of characters from the stories, players attempt to collect the lead person in line. Bonus points are awarded for collecting certain sets of characters.

Players use action cards to manipulate the line to get the characters they want most.

This game is an homage to / re-implementation of Guillotine.

name: Countryopoly
description:
"Countryopoly combines the fun of a property trading game with instruments used in today's country music. Players start at the sign with the arrow and proceed clockwise. Players build houses and hotels and choose from the unique "Pick'n'Grin" cards meant to keep them grinning, or they may be forced to take a "Grin'n'Bear" card. They will need loads of luck for those. Players may accidently land on "Karaoke Korner." In that event they must proceed to sing their favorite country song. All other players must judge the performance and pay them what they think the performance is worth. "Karaoke Korner" may wish to be avoided! And watch out for the "Slammer!" Play Countryopoly with family and friends and find out how much fun it is! Traditional play or one hour version. 2-6 players, Ages 8 and up."

From the publishers website

name: Dungeon Derby
description:
A free Print and Play fantasy labyrinth fighting game with RPG elements for 1-4 players.

Each player controls one character of one of eight different classes, which respawns if killed. Players take turns moving and taking two different actions such as Attacking a monster or another player, Casting a spell (either from a spellbook or as a one-shot from a scroll), Picking up an object, Exchanging items in town, or Upgrading stats and Equipping items and skills. After a player's turn, any nearby monsters move toward that player and attack if able.

The goal is to collect 5 points by picking up Flags and delivering them to the entrance and/or killing the Dragon. Each time a player picks up a flag, more powerful monsters, a free item, and a flag are placed in the labyrinth. The Dragon, by far the deadliest monster, spawns after a player collects 4 flags.
