This game is "beta"; it has no art and the rules and rulebook are unrefined. However, it is in a playable state, and the author will accept any feedback and incorporate suggestions into new versions.

Contains-
8 Characters
149 Tokens (flags, treasure, wounds, upgrades, mana, experience)
9 Dungeon tiles
235 Cards in two decks (113 weapons, armor, shields, headgear, boots, rings, mounts; 122 spells, skills, special actions, and minor items)
32 monster chits
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Lifeguard on Duty
description:
Swimming pools can be very dangerous. You have been hired as a lifeguard. Each shift, the kids line up to get in and swim. As more children enter the pool, it is your duty to assign them safe areas to swim. If a child is paired up with a swim buddy, parents tend to reward you for taking care of their kids. When an area of the pool gets too full, kids get bored and leave. If there are a lot of kids playing in your area, you are considered to be a good lifeguard. If you help enough kids you will gain favor with the Boss. It is always good when the boss likes you.

Players take the part of lifeguards assigning buddies to the children entering the pool. They will choose the best area of the pool to guard, hoping the children will be happiest there. The Boss will reward the lifeguard who has the best reputation, allowing the lifeguards to rank up. If ranking to a level 5, that player wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Set Collection

name: Vacation USA
description:
In Vacation USA, players roll dice and move around the board to various locations. They may opt to take a vacation on any landmark site they land on, or hold their money in hopes of landing on higher point value sites later. Players also may purchase Insurance cards one at a time (one at the start of the game, one on landing upon a white state), and must draw Hazard cards on red states. Hazards cost money, but may be ignored with the proper insurance. Each player may also borrow $1000 from the bank up to two times in the game to cover expenses.

The object of Vacation USA is to be the first player to accumulate at least 2500 points without owing any money.

Vacation USA claims to be an "Educational Experience", aiding the players in learning about U.S. vacation sites.

name: Columbia: the Next America Game
description:
This appears to be a promotional item devised at the request of the Rouse Company. Centered on the planned community in Columbia, MD, this game offers players the opportunity, "to become a developer in the NEXT AMERICA, COLUMBIA." Players must accumulate wealth and property in order to win.

As with Monopoly, upon which this game is strongly based, "Columbia: the Next America" ends when all but one player goes bankrupt, at the end of a predetermined time, or, in a unique addition, "when the next feature comes on the cable."

The center photo for the game board, as well as the game box, feature an 1982 aerial view of Columbia, MD.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Judgment
description:
Judgment is a board game created by Miles Ratcliffe and, although some thought by Chaos Publishing Ltd. has been put into to publishing the game, it is not due to be published any time soon.

'Prepare to step into a whole new fantasy world full of magic and adventure as you battle your way through your quests like never before.

On a distant world, far from our reach, there was land full of magic and prosperity; where the just had ruled over the corrupt for many a millennia. Now a great force has thrown this world into chaos, separating the land into eight domains, just as this great power has been divided. Ultimate power will be granted to the one who can control this incredible force; and, as the chaos has spread across this once prosperous land, the evil and corrupt have made their return - who will claim judgment!

Play as one of 16 characters as you try to collect the chaos fragments to either restore the world to prosperity or damn it to destruction.

Judgment can be played with 2-8 players as each player plays out their strategy trying to out-wit each opponent as they battle creatures, cast spells, collect gold and purchase wargear to claim all the chaos fragments and exact judgment on the world!'

name: Four Card Drax
description:
Four Card Drax is a card game that is played in the Battletech Universe and represents a poker game. Its picture cards are not counted towards the hand, but alter the value of the cards you have.
There are 4 suits -- Kurita [red], Steiner [blue], Marik [purple], Davion [orange] -- consisting of 1-10, Lancer, Rifleman, and Regent.
The game is described in the House Marik Source Book, p. 120.

name: Het Nieuw Vermakelijk Brandweerspel
description:
It's like The Game of Goose.
There are 50 blocks with pictures of the Amsterdam fire brigade. The player that reaches the headquartes of the Amsterdam Fire Department, in the middle of the board, wins the game.

name: The Syllable Game
description: This teaching game comes for early readers comes with rules for three different games using the three sets of cards in the game. There are rules for competitive, solitare, and double-solitare.

name: I Need A Sign!
description:
We need an ambulance! Call the police! The building is on fire! A pipe is broken and the street is flooded. There is a blackout. The phone is dead. When will that letter arrive?
As the director-general of a public service department, you are responsible for sending service vehicles to the places where their help is required, but in a city without street signs, this might be close to impossible. Fortunately, the local government has launched a street addressing program, and as street signs are placed all around the city, giving directions will become easier.
Players collaborate developing the street addressing program, and compete to get the highest score by being the best at giving and following directions through the city.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Clown Around
description:
The player with the red pawn starts the game. Each player spins and moves the spaces shown by the spinner. When a player stops at as shoe-space the player has to move his pawn up or down the path indicated, while saying: 'Clown Around.'
If a player neglets to move his pawn or say 'Clown Around', before the other player moves, the playerloses a turn. At his next turn, the player continues moving along the path.
A player may not stop on a space that is occupied. Instead the player moves the pawn a space forward. When the plays nears the end of the path, the player must spin the exact number of spaces.

The winner is the first player arrives at the circus.

name: Countryside and Village
description: An American Adventure Game. "Explore the village lanes and country roads of an 1830s New England community. In this game based on old Sturbridge Village, you will take your "family" through four seasons of activity. Hazards and windfalls await you, as do opportunity and difficulty. Will you find yourself better off when accounts are reckoned come New Years Day? Find out by playing this educational and detailed game!" Countryside and Village takes you through four seasons of life in an 1830s New England community. Keep a careful ledger and good relations with your neighbors. The ups and downs of life come into play where tradition and the winds of change make each new year a challenge.

name: 2D Yacht
description: Played with 25 dice and 5x5 grid. Each die individually first rolled then placed immediately on open grid space and not relocated thereafter. Object: create scored five dice "hands" horizontally and vertically (10 hands total).

name: Unus Dies in Circo Maximo
description: A game for 2 to 6 players, plus aedile (moderator) and iudex (referee in case of disputes), if desired. The game is designed for practice in Latin-roots-to-English-words.

name: 5 to Close
description:
[from Publisher]

Teamwork is crucial in this exciting word game. Build words with your partner. The longer the better. But be careful! Unlocked words receive no points when the round ends. Use special cards to double or triple word point values or freeze opponent's words. A great game for groups and parties!

Best played with 4, 6 or 8 players in teams of two.

After dealing 7 cards to each player, each player attempts to make words with their cards (with help from their teammate when it's their turn - who sits opposite) No more than 5 active words can be in front of any player at any given time. A word can be frozen or "locked" (turned over face down) and no more letter cards can be placed on that word(s). Teams work together in creating more or longer words. The longer word, the more points. Always at the end of each player's turn, he/she draws back up to 7.

There are special card in the deck including Wild (any letter A-Z), Double and Triple cards the double and triple the value of those words, Freeze which can lock an opponents word and Unfreeze which unlocks your own word.

There are special instructions in the game for 2, 3, 5, or 7 players.

name: Settlements
description:
Two groups of people decide to settle the same valley and become neighbours. They start to build houses, farms and markets. Little by little building small towns that will become great cities. As it is human nature these two human groups start competing for having the wealthiest city, the most productive farms, amazing monuments and the mightiest army.

Will you be a rich mogul or a powerful warlord? Will you do it by producing and selling or will your way be the way of the sword?

Take control of a small settlement and develop it into a mighty city estate!

You will need a d10 die to be able to play this game.

name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Neighborhood Memory Game
description:
Every neighborhood is full of memories just waiting to be made. Delight in these everyday discoveries with this puzzle memory game.

Put the bird inside the fire truck. Is it a match? Look, how silly! Let’s try again and look for the nest...

Pop center pieces into frames to make matches and create the perfect moment together, with lots of giggles along the way.

What's in the box?
Let's Play Neighborhood Memory Game includes 24 colorful, interlocking pieces

name: Einmal um den H√§userblock
description: This game aims at telling children how to behave in traffic. The game board is unusual: When set up, it is an actual (three-dimensional) house with sidewalks around it. Players move around with die rolls. Some squares they land on give special moves or make you lose a turn. First player who makes it around the block is the winner.

name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Sandwich Stacker Cookout Game
description:
Let’s Play Sandwich Stacker Cookout Game is pretend-food fun plus a match-and-stack game—in one! Players take turns using the menu spinner and matching what they spin to an ingredient to add to the silly sandwich. Or they can pile on favorite ingredients to make a special sandwich all their own. It’s a recipe for serving up smiles!

What's in the box?
Let’s Play Sandwich Stacker Game includes a menu spinner, storage bag, and 12 stackable play-food pieces.

name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Sandwich Stacker Lunchtime Game
description:
Let’s Play Sandwich Stacker Lunchtime Game is pretend-food fun plus a match-and-stack game—in one! Players take turns using the menu spinner and matching what they spin to an ingredient to add to the silly sandwich. Or they can pile on favorite ingredients to make a special sandwich all their own. It’s a recipe for serving up smiles!

What's in the box?
Let’s Play Sandwich Stacker Game includes a menu spinner, storage bag, and 12 stackable play-food pieces.

name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Shop & Match Game
description:
Bakery scents tango with red ripe mangos. Shopping carts wiggle-jiggle down the aisles. Share in the fun of exploring the grocery store with this sort-and-match game.

Find bananas, macaroni and cheese... all the foods on your list. Beep your scanner as you fill up your grocery basket.

It's a treasure hunt for your favorite foods -- and what you'll find are magical moments together.

What's in the box?
Let's Play Shop & Match Game includes the grocery store game board, grocery basket, 16 play food pieces, scanner, spinner, 8 reusable grocery lists, and erasable pen.

name: Napoleon's Grande Armee
description:
Richard Berg follows up Chainmail with NAPOLEON’S GRANDE ARMEE. The game will use the Chainmail card system to recreate four exciting battles that follow one of the greatest military leaders of all time. No dice and no charts. The battles included will be Austerlitz, Lutzen, Wagram, and Ligny. The game will include a map, counters, rules, and cards.

The game uses cards, one deck for each player (whose cards are somewhat different from those of the other player) to drive the game. Each player gets a certain number of cards each turn - but never his full deck. The cards are used to determine movement, combat, and actions. is thus a game of card play and management, which unfolds on the historical battle map - it uses squares, rather than hexes with the use of some beautiful, super-size counters. No dice are used. And there are no CRT’s. Skill determines the outcome.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Missionary Blues
description:
Missionary Blues is a card game similar to Crazy Eights. The cards all have a Mormon Missionary Theme. Players must match the top card of the discard pile with either the same suit or a matching number. Whenever a player changes suit, either by number or one of the wild cards, s/he collects a Letter from the Mission President Card, which has a point value. At the end of the game, the player with the highest point total wins.

Special cards that cause opponents to Draw Four, Reverse play order, and discard all cards of one color are included and have artwork relevant to Mormon missionaries such as Zone Leaders, APs, and a "Little Devil" - which can bounce the power of a negative card back to the player.

name: Route et V√©lodrome
description:
French cycling game from the '60s about the Tour de France. The game board measure 41 x 32.5 cm, goal is to reach Paris first

From : http://users.telenet.be/wielerbordspellen/spellen/spel131/sp...
"Replica of the old game “Jeu de Touristes et Jeu de Vélodrome that was originally published around 1910 by Saussine in Paris. This replica has appeared in the French cycling magazine Miroir de Cyclisme number 112 of April 1969. The magazine has the dimensions 34 x 26.5 cm, the game board measure 41 x 32.5 cm. Mirroir the Cyclisme have appealed to the collection of Rene Geslin to bring out this reprint. In the course of years, several versions of this game have been published. For example one with the name “Tour the France Cycliste “ in the Fifties.

It is a simple game of goose where a cycling game is played along the outer track of the game board and on the other hand a (initially) tourist car game on the track with the map of France. In the original game cyclists, small cars and bonus cards were provided.

Whit this version comes only the game board and the game rules.

In the version of the years ' 50 the layout of the game board has been preserved, but the characters and symbolism has been adapted to the era. Also the rules have been strongly simplified. In the original game bonus points could be deserved at stage wins, this has been completely deleted from the rules and everything has been reduced to a simple game of goose.".

name: Firlefanz
description: This game consists of 25 letter tiles and five sets of rules. The basic concept is to put all tiles face-down on the table and start flipping them over, forming words from the open letters. The variants add a memory aspect, cross-word laying and also a cooperative game in which all players try to form a word using the last opened letters.

name: Dachshund Races
description:
(From the website)
They're short, they're long, they're Dachshunds and they are ready to race. Be the first to cross the finish line, but beware of loose treats, stray cats and the urge to stop and lick your paws.

Roll the dice and move the lowest of your rolls, but beware, if you roll all of the same number, you stop to lick your paws. Use rockets and robolegs to speed up your dachshund or drop treats or peanut butter to slow down your opponents. Do you have what it takes to win three races and take the glory?

Includes:

* Dachshund Races Board
* Dachshund Racers Deck (6 cards)
* Upgrade Cards Deck (60 cards)
* Rules Document
* 1 Joystick Pawn - Blue
* 1 Joystick Pawn - Red
* 6 D6 (16mm) - Bone
* 1 Wink (3/4" | 19mm) - Green (~40 ct)
* 1 Wink (3/4" | 19mm) - Green (~40 ct)
* 1 Joystick Pawn - Yellow
* 4 D10 (22mm) - Random Color
* 1 Joystick Pawn - Brown
* 1 Joystick Pawn - Purple
* 1 Plastic Bags - 3"x4"
* 1 Joystick Pawn - Green
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Quest: A New Age
description:
In Quest: A New Age, the purpose of the game is to take your Adventuring Party into each Dungeon and attempt to complete your assigned Quest Objective. This can be done as a Solo player or with any number of players controlling and arguing over the party members. (I have run one of my D&D groups through it with 8 people as the party)
Your Adventuring Party is made up of 5 Unique and Specific Classes that must be represented as you begin the game. Each class has a Hero that Begins at Level 1 and can advance up to Level 5 during game play. Most 1st level Heroes need 3xp to advance to level two. 7xp more to advance to level three, 10-15 more to level four, and 18-24 to level five. This depends on the class and individual Hero.
Here is a list of the 19 Heroes that we have at this time and what they are at each level.
Protection Class:
Griff - Journeyman - Fighter - Warrior - Barbarian - Berserker
Sonya - Wanderer - Explorer - Questing - Paladin - Angel
Olli - Son of Hamfast - Pikeman - Squire - Knight - Crusader
Solarion - Footman - Swordsman - Lieutentant - Captain - General
Death Class:
Selene - Outlaw - Bandit - Thief - Rogue - Shadow
Gabriel - Urchin - of the Streets - Minstrel - Bard - Muse
Grimm - Outlaw - Bandit - Enforcer - Assassin - Reaper
Sabban - Rebel - Renegade - Deciever - Deserter - Betrayer
Nature Class:
Richard - Farmer - Woodsman - Guide - Scout - Ranger
Isseili - the Fey - Forester - Naturalist - Druid - Warden
Venr - Awakened - Scavenger - Hungering - Feasting - Vampire
Magic Class:
Marteel - Novice - Adept - Wizard - Mage - Archmage
Callius - Novice - Adept - Cultist - Warlock - Demon
Zaphian - Underling - Adept - Sorcerer - Necromancer - Lich
Rymar - Stonehead - Preserved - Protected - Encased - Fortified
Life Class;
Dana - Follower - Acolyte - Healer - Priestess - High Priestess
Jesse - Follower - Acolyte - Brother - Preacher - Martyr
Sarah - Searching - Enlightened - Forgiving - Redeemed - Guardian Spirit
Mary - Acolyte - Cleric - Devoted - Blessed - Saint

The Adventure consists of a 60 card Dungeon, which has one Quest Objective, Terrain, Creatures, Equipment, Effects, Fast Effects, Events, and other Items. There are always two Unigue Tier Creature Cards that can be interchanged after completion of each Tier to make the adventure last longer and become more difficult. The eight Adventures that we have complete are listed below with the amount of games played, completion rate, and Quest Objective.
Goblin Kingdom - 71/120 60% Goblin King
Dead Marshes - 58/90 63% Lord of the Undead
Demonic Rift - 35/63 54% Balor
Ruby Mountain - 31/64 49% Ancient Red Dragon
Forsaken City - 25/51 50% King of the Streets
Nature's Abundance 23/50 46% Ancient Treant
Dangerous Seas - 21/47 38% Captain Davy Jones
Tomb Kingdom - 17/50 34% Tomb King
We are planning on a total of 10 adventures to become available in the future.

Game-play:
In Quest: A New Age there are Abilities, Upgrades, and four stat Values -- Accuracy, Armor, Life, and Damage.
Abilities differ for each Hero and Creature according to their assigned value in the game, (e.g. a Goblin Recruit has no abilities and is worth 1 point value, while a Goblin Captain has a value of 3 and grants abilities to other Goblins).
5 levels of Upgrade are available to each Hero and are earned in the Dungeon as the party delves deeper into the adventure. As you gain XP from Terrain, Trap, and Creature cards, you can spend the XP to make your Heroes stronger.
Accuracy is the Hero or Creatures base accuracy which you then combine with a roll of a D20 to attempt to hit.
Armor is the Hero or Creatures base defense against attacks.
Life is the Hero or Creatures base damage that they can take before dying.
Damage is the Hero or Creatres base damage they can inflict against another.
Phases of the Game:
1) Quest Deck - Turn over the appropiate amount of cards. Fast Effects happen at this time and can change how many cards are turned over.
2) Effects - Any Effects that are turned over happen at this time.
3) Hero1 - All Heroes have one action per turn, which can be used to either Attack, Heal, Pick Up and item or attempt to Disarm a trap. The Hero may also Hold their action for Hero2 phase.
4) Dungeon - Any surviving Creatures may perform one action at this time.
5) Hero2 - The Heroes that held their action can now act.
6) Events - Events such as traps that have not been disarmed and other Events take place at this time.
7) End of Turn - End of Turn abilities such as Regenerate and Aura's take place at this time.
8) Upgrade - XP that has been collected can now be used to upgrade your Heroes. When a Hero is upgraded they gain full health. Once XP has been spent on a Hero, it cannot be used again.
Start the Phases over at this time.
The game begins by shuffling your Quest Deck and turning over three cards. As the game progresses and your Heroes are upgraded, you start to turn over more cards to make the Adventure more difficult. The Breakdown is as follows:
Game Begins - 3 Cards per turn
After Two Hero Upgrades - 4 Cards per turn
After Five Hero Upgrades - 5 Cards per turn
After Eight Hero Upgrades - 6 Cards per turn
After Ten Hero Upgrades - 7 Cards per turn
After Twelve Hero Upgrades - 8 cards per turn
Rules Questions:
1) When Attacking you take the Accuracy and add a D20 roll. That roll must equal or beat the targets Armor. You do not have to roll when Healing or using an Ability unless it is used as an attack.
2) Melee characters cannot target Ranged characters unless all other Melee opponents are defeated.
3) Rolls of a 1 are considered an Epic Fail and always miss. Rolls of 20 are considered a Critical Strike and always hit, in addition a Critical causes Double damage to the target.
4) All XP this is collected goes into a community pool which can be used at the direction of the Party's controller or controller's.
5) As an overall rule: The Cant's outweigh the Can's

We did a short Demo on youtube which is quite boring but you are free to take a look at the mechanics of the game. :)
http://www.youtube.com/user/HiddenKeep#play/all/uploads-all/...
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Preventit
description:
The first-aid and safety game for all ages.
"Pick a playing piece and race your opponents around the outer board to enter the wheel. Everyone gets the chance to be "Question Master" and take charge of the time buzzer."

From the start square players roll the dice and move. The player is asked a safety or first-aid question related to the topic of the square they land on. A timer is started once the question has been read and the answer must be given before the timer sounds.

Once a player has completed the external track on the board they enter the central area and then must answer questions based on the spinner result. If answering successfully the player gets to point to one PREVENTIT lettercard of any opponent. If it is the correct colour they add it to their scorecard. If it is not the correct colour the lettercard remains face-down in front of the opponent. In either case play passes to the next player.

Win: The first player to fill their PREVENTIT scorecard wins.

name: Gefahren erkennen
description: There is a large map which shows 16 situations in traffic. In seven cases the people are acting correctly, in nine they do wrong. During the course of the game, kids have to put puzzle pieces onto the map to complete the situations. This game is aimed at the very young, and after a few rounds they will know the correct location for each puzzle piece.

name: Geisterfahrer
description: Players circle a highway with their four cars. But there are two black cars who are wrong-way drivers. When a car hits one of them (they can be moved by the players, too), that car is out. The player with most "surviving" cars after a round wins.

name: P√∂bbar√∂lt √≠ Reykjav√≠k
description: A drinking game where players try to collect bar-cards of which there are only six, two for each of the three pubs on the playing board. Players must solve the challenge on the bar-card to receive the card. When players land on other spaces on the track they have to follow the instructions (allowed to go to the bathroom, roll again, draw a card and so on).

name: Project: Last Hope
description:
Project: Last Hope is a game for up to 12 players, playable in 2-4 hours. The game is set on the world of Aquea, whose inhabitants have suddenly found themselves forcibly bound together in order to save themselves from a terrible new threat that has, by all appearances, emerged from another world to consume theirs.

Each of the players commands a mighty orbiting warship from which they deploy strike teams to the planet's surface in order to repel attacks, secure resources, construct fortifications and – hopefully – assist in breaking the siege (even if only temporarily).

Players will have to strike a balance between acting altruistically to assist their fellow players in repelling the invaders and acting in self-interest so that they not only survive but emerge a major power in the world.
categories: Adventure, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Out Of The Frying Pan
description:
A card game of strategic investment, arson, and insurance fraud, where players earn money on restaurants they have a stake in.

Welcome to an epicurean adventure of gastronomical proportions!

It's time to leap from your economically restricting frying pan straight into the incendiary excitement of investing in your own restaurant.

But beware!

The culinary industry poses high risks and vicious competition. In fact, no food vendor has ever turned a profit, since the invention of the restaurant over 4,000 years ago, except for those vendors who moonlight as arsonists.

That's right, your only hope is to collect the insurance money on your establishment. However, burning down your own restaurant is a sure fire way to get yourself put on ice by the fuzz. You'll have to rely on silent partners and the kindness of strangers to light up your livelihood.

Components

* 35 Restaurant Cards
* 1 First Player Card
* 42 Investment Markers (7 in each of 6 colors)
* 50 $1,000 Bills
* 25 $5,000 Bills
* Rules for playing Out Of The Frying Pan

Available at http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/out-of-the-frying-pan
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Stock Holding, Team-Based Game
publishers: Gorman Games, LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Desafio da Fortuna
description: The players roll the dice in this Monopoly Style game for win money and finish the biggest milionaire in the room

name: Girlz Only
description:
Girlz Only is a fun Girls night in game that finds out exactly what kind of personality you & your friends really have.

Are you a B#tch... a Tart... or an Angel?

Well this game will find out!

Players answer questions on lads, sex etc,.. make lifestyle choices on fashion, makeup, music etc,.. decide on moral dilemmas at work & in relationships,.. act out silly charades and of course down one or two drinks in the process.

Points are scored based on the answers given or how well your perform.

The game is great fun, quite risque and very enlightening & you should be very broadminded to play it.

Don't just have another night in..Have a GIRLZ ONLY night in!

B#tch..Tart..or Angel..you will soon know the truth!

Knickers....red, white or commando?

Your favourite position is?

Your favourite kinky outfit is?

Contents: Game board, Rules, 6 playing pieces, 50 bitch cards, 50 tart cards, 50 angel cards, 50 chance cards, wine glass, dice, score pad.

name: Heia Safari
description: Dexterity game in which the players use rubber bands to shoot chips onto a game board. The first shot is aimed at catching an animal (which succeeds when the chip stops on a line that is connected to an animal), if the second shot stops in the center field of the game board, the player can release all animals of one kind (from the other players). The first player to catch seven different animals is the winner.

name: Jet-Set
description: Players roll dice and walk around a large game board. On each square they land, they have to fulfill certain tasks. However, when they have to draw an event card, for example, they can choose to use it immediately or at any point later. To win, all cards must have been played. During the game, players also have to collect 15 objects (hotels, airlines etc.). And lastly, the winner needs to have at least 100 million dollars.

name: RolaGolf
description:
RolaGolf is a game for all the family, young and not so young, golfer or non-golfer, and can be played in a variety of ways:

1. Stroke-Play
2. Match-Play
3. Match-Play Foursomes
4. Match-Play Greensomes
5. Bogey Matches
6. Stableford

The dice (cubes) must be thrown individually in strict sequence: RED (Drive) YELLOW (2nd shot) BLUE (3rd shot) BLACK (4th shot) GREEN (putts); unless the result of the throw indicates otherwise.

The 6 variants have differnt goals to reach. In most forms the player have to reach the most holes in an agreed number of strockes, or to count how many strockes they need for an agreed number of holes.

The matches can be played in pairs what will made a max. 12 of player.

name: Sabotagem
description:
Cunning and cold-blooded to be the best secret agent!
During a meeting that took place in a big city with the most powerful world leaders, a suitcase containing invaluable state secrets has been stolen. The best secret agents were summoned to the task of retrieving the information contained in this bag and the winner will receive one million dollar reward, besides knowing the oldest secrets of the mankind. Uncover your opponents and abuse the nerve to not be discovered and enter into history as the best secret agent of all time"(Translated from the game box)
Each player represents a secret agent, but there may be ghosts agents (additional pawns). On his turn, the player moves any agents, distributing the total movement points obtained among the agents he wants to move. When one or more pawns stop at the building where the suitcase is, all players score: the pawn which is the suitcase’s building receives 5 points and the other pawns receive points corresponding to the buildings where they are at this moment. At the beginning of the game, each player only knows its own identity. Thus, the game has two objectives: to win more points by moving the pawns (the game ends when someone reaches 42 points) and earn additional points, by discovering the identity of other agents (this is done, once someone reaches 32 points, placing numbered chips into the slots of the forecasts bases).

name: Polygo
description:
55 playing cards of irregular four-sided shape, and each card can have 0, 1, 2, 3 or 4 different colour segments, plus a letter of the alphabet.
All games proposed use the same 6 simple matching rules to decide which moves are legal or not.

You can play with them all traditional card games, but the rulebook offers also 11 new and very different games to play:

1) Pentago (for 2-4 players)
By matching your cards by colour with that on the table, you must play all your cards or block your opponents from playing.

2) Polygo Word (for 2-6 players)
The object is to score as many points as possible by forming a single dictionary word of 2 or more letters, using always at least 1 letter from a previous word.

3) Polygo Challenge 2001
A solo game, where you must build a 7x7 block of cards, each matching by colour segment with at least another near card.

4) Astack (for 2-4 players)
Stacking cards you must play all your cards first, or force your opponent to pick more cards.

5) Solo 1
A solitaire game: object is to transfer all cards from the deck to three colums, and then to a final play pile.

6) Solo 2
Beat your own score by drawing cards and playing them on the table only if you can find at least one match with the previously placed cards.

7) Polywords (for 2-5 players)
By placing cards in a crossword style you must form any to or more letter dictionary words.

8) 5-Up (for 2-6 players)
A Pentago variant, where cards must by played inside a block a 5x5 cards.

9) Polygo Whist (for 2-8 players)
Win most Tricks and score as high as possible by playing every hand the highest ranking Trump or the highest leading Suit.

10) Polygo Rummy (for 2-6 players)
Be the first to meld all your cards of the same Suit with at least one segment of the same colour.

11) Polygo Shape Puzzles (for 1-8 players)
Try to beat your score or of your opponents by placing cards to form one of five possible shapes with matching cards.

name: Kilohurtz
description:
Using “Nano-Bots” as computer programming aids, you are trying to create circuit pathways to allow your nano-bots to complete their assigned programs before your opponents do.

But you’ll have to watch out for other players nano-bots that are trying to throw you off the board into a heat sink, or giving you advanced programing codes you don’t need. The board has a unique relay system that flips over every time a nano-bot crosses over one, possibly changing your path to victory!

name: Stratrivia
description:
Enhance any Trivia game with a dose of Strategy!

The objective of Stratrivia is to get the highest score in two ways: answering Trivia Questions correctly and controlling as many Strat Squares at the end of the game as possible.
You do this by moving your piece around the Trivia Board by rolling dice and winning strategic squares on the Strat Board by answering trivia questions correctly (which also give you points).

A+A Games is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 2.5 South Africa LicenseBased on the work distributed at Board Game Geek.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Print & Play, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Check 4
description:
Check 4 bills itself as “the most exciting change to the game of checkers in 300 years!”

Check 4 consists of seven different games for two or four persons or teams:

Four-Way Checkers - The traditional checker game played with four people with some rules changes.

Teleportation - Uses special board squares allowing players to move and materialize at other places on the board. 2 or 4 players.

Players Chance - Same rules as Four-Way Checkers, played with dice. The dice determine who is allowed to move each turn. 2 or 4 players.

Six-Piece Checkers - Each player starts with six pieces. Additional pieces may be earned as the game progresses. 2 or 4 players.

Decoy - Each player has 12 pieces, consisting of six pieces of two colors each. One set is real, the other is a decoy. 2 players.

Protection - Each player has 12 pieces, 3 of which are a different color. Get one of the special pieces home safe to win. 2 players.

Super Diagonal - Each player has 12 pieces, 4 of which are a different color. The four special pieces are allowed to move more than one space at a time. 2 players.

The board is an 8x8 grid, with an additional 3x8 starting section along each side for each player. The checkers come in four sets of 12.

name: Glokess
description:
Glokess is an abstract game. Players place pieces on the board, then moves or rotate them in order to capture the opposing pieces. The inspiration for the game comes from Blokus, Go, and Chess.

Setup
Each player gets the all the pieces of the same colour. The pieces are coloured on both sides.

Game Play
Each player alternates in taking turns. During the player’s turn, the player can perform 1 on the following
(1) place a piece on the board
(2) move a piece already on the board
(3) rotate a piece already on the board.
(4) flip a piece already on the board

The piece rotates with its black square as its axis, and can be rotated any number of right angles. After rotation, its black square must be at the same location. Similarly, if a piece is flipped, its black square must be at the same location.

Each piece moves according to its structure. Taking its black square as the center, the piece moves to any of the coloured square.

name: Alien Sen So
description:
Yes, you are an Alien! All you need to know: Is it a predator or prey? You will send in a spawnling to find out. If it is prey, then this battle will be over quickly. If it is a threat, then caution and strategy may be required to take it down. Either way you will be the last thing standing when the acid blood is done spraying.

The Alien brings Acid Blood and Spawnlings to Sen So. If you like causing damage and chasing down your foes, the Alien is perfect for you. The Alien is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

name: Archer Sen So
description:
Yes, you are an Archer! You have sharp eyes and a steady hand. Distance is your ally and few can avoid your deadly shots. If you can see the target you can hit it. You have many targets to choose from; it is now just a matter of which one to start with.

The Archer brings 8 unique cards and introduces the full set of Aim cards to Sen So. If you like ranged combat and keeping your foes on there toes, the Archer is perfect for you. The Archer is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

name: Gladiator Sen So
description:
Yes, you are a Gladiator! You have two strong arms, one for each weapon. The enemies are new, but this is nothing new, arena combat is your life. The crowd and you grow restless; it is time once again to bask in yet another victory.

The Gladiator brings the Gladius, Spatha, Parma(shield) and Net to Sen So. If you like dual wielding and dishing out damage, the Gladiator is perfect for you. The Gladiator is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

name: Robot Sen So
description:
Yes you are a robot! Does that compute? Designed as the ultimate fighting machine combat is all you know. Any opponent that faces you in the arena will be put to the test. You cannot and will not be stopped! All other contestants will fall before your next rest cycle. It is time for you to do what you were made for…FIGHT!

The Robot brings Metal Hide and Repair Kits to Sen So. If you like steady resilience and recovery, the Robot is perfect for you. The Robot is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

name: Space Hunter Sen So
description:
Yes, you are a Space Hunter! Everything is your prey. Big or small, you hunt it all. Technology is your aid, but it is only used to enhance the thrill of the hunt. You delight in surprising your target, but savor when it surprises you. You have found something interesting, let’s hope it is fun to stalk.

The Space Hunter brings Auto Laser, Force Shell, Self Destruct and Distortion Shell to Sen So. If you like starting with an advantage and having tricks up your sleeve, the Space Hunter is perfect for you. The Space Hunter is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

name: Viking Sen So
description:
Yes, you are a Viking! Your fierce flying attacks are legendary. Leading with your Axe, you force your foe to give way or pay the price. Not many understand or appreciate the power of a sharp axe, now is the time for you to show them.

The Viking brings the Hand Axe, Shield and War Axe to Sen So. If you like being aggressive and keeping your foes at bay, the Viking is perfect for you. The Viking is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Real-time

name: Zombie Sen So
description:
Yes you are a Zombie! You will never be at rest. You “live” to make sure nothing else does. Everything must die, if it moves it must die. How did you get in this arena? It does not matter…Look! There is something moving over there…it is time to KILL once again.

The Zombie brings Squishy Flesh and Arm-O-Rang to Sen So. If you like not having to think about what to do or being able to take a hit, the Zombie is perfect for you. The Zombie is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.
categories: Fighting, Horror, Real-time, Science Fiction, Zombies

name: Pirate Sen So
description:
Everyone has a nemesis and the Pirate has the Ninja. Sen So started out as a Ninja Combat Board Game. Wells it is now more than that. The Sen So Pirate is the balanced counter part to the Ninja. Same abilities with a Double Flintlock pistol for one extra shot. If you don’t like Ninja and have a Pirate spirit, the Sen So Pirate is perfect for you. The Pirate is a single player set that can be played against any of the Sen So variants.

The Sen So game system uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to set (program) actions before their current action is revealed. All players reveal actions together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players. Game scoring provides balance and keeps the leaders on their toes. Players are required to choose their weapons and abilities for each battle.

name: Classic Dinner Party:  Dine with William Shakespeare and Anne Hathaway
description:
A dinner party for 8 people intending to recreate a setting similar to one in Shakespeare's time. This only slightly qualifies as a game as the box includes a small set of trivia cards to play with during the dinner. It is intended more as a fun dinner with a theme.

From the box: "This box contains the ingredients for a unique and historic dining experience. You and your guests can travel back in time, taste the flavours, discover the story and become part of one very special moment in European history."

The game consists of 48 trivia cards to divide amongst two teams after the meal. The team with the most correct answers wins the game.

name: Monkey Rummy
description:
At last... a rummy game with Monkeys! Every type of monkey has a different ability and you can either play them for VP (well, bananas) or play them for their action. You can only play one action card a turn but if you have a meld of monkeys in front of you, you get to play their action for free each turn.

This game is an entry to the Themed Rummy Design Contest Judged by Mike Fitzgerald

name: Feeding the Alphabet
description:
Feeding the Alphabet is a children's educational game designed to teach the alphabet. The game comes with two types of cards, one that has a letter on it and the other that has a picture of food. Players take turns drawing cards trying to match the letters to the food items, i.e. C - Cheese, O - Onion, H - Hot Dog.

The winner is the player who makes the most matches.

name: Jani b√°csi sz√≥rak√≥ja
description: Every player gets seven letters and has to write down words made using these letters. After two minutes, everybody gets his/her neighbor's letters, this way everybody has the same chance.

name: Kalm√°r
description: Players are merchants traveling around Europe during the renaissance. They can buy and sell goods in some important cities, but they have to beware of bandits and pirates. The first player to return to Rome with enough money and goods wins the game.

name: Fifi's Stack-a-cake
description: Very simple children's game. Roll the dice and put the appropriate layer on Fifi's cake - but try not to topple the whole thing.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Argosy Command
description:
Introduction text:

Argosy Command
A game of starship miniatures combat.

These rules are designed to allow players to quickly design fleets and get right to playing. Battles involving over a dozen ships per side should be resolved within a couple hours play easily. While not as detailed or full of options as several other games available, this should be appropriate for even small children to understand and enjoy until they are ready themselves to move on to more challenging rule sets. Above all, it is hoped that the rules presented here provide an enjoyable experience to all that choose to play, for a game that is without fun...is simply not a game at all.

The ships portrayed within the Argosy Command universe travel between stars by means of wormholes and may represent various races as characterized and postulated by the likes of H.G. Wells, Jules Verne, and other such literary notables at the turn of the 20th Century.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sovereignty!!
description:
In Sovereignty!! the king has died leaving no heir to the throne. You are a noble who sees this as an opportunity to grab power. In order to place yourself on the throne, you will have to win the support of the people, gather valuable resources, collect taxes, raise an army, and finally obtain tactical information on your opponent. The player who uses their skills at bribery, sabotage, and brute force the most effectively will capture the throne!

This game is played over 4 rounds with opponents competing to claim 6 objective cards per round. To do this each player places a card face down at each of the objectives. When all cards are placed there is a showdown where players claim their gained obectives. New objectives are then drawn, hands are refreshed, and the next round begins! The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

This game was designed as an alternate version of the card game War with shorter game lengths and addition of decision making. After a redo in March 2010 it is now a set collection game with 5 varying types of objectives with 7 cards of each type (3x standard card, 1x +1 bonus, 1x +2 bonus, 1x +3 bonus, and 1x +1 per card of this type).
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Doodaddy
description:
Doodaddy is a family dice game, similar to 10,000, where each player collects points during his/her turn, which he/she may add to his total, or not, depending on how aggressively or cautiously he/she plays.

As each player rolls during his/her turn, the player is looking to score points, in the form of sets. If a roll scores any points, he may set aside any number of sets that he wants to claim points from, and either: 1) roll all remaining dice, hoping to score additional Sets., 2) roll all six dice again if all six dice have scored points, or 3) calculate the points and move on. A player has to start with 500 points to get on the table. If a roll scores nothing, the turn is forfeited, and it’s the next players turn.

Points…
a single 1 : 100
a single 5 : 50
triple of 1's : 1000
triple of 2's : 200
triple of 3's : 300
triple of 4's : 400
triple of 5's : 500
triple of 6's : 600
six-of-a-kind : Instant winner
three pair (DOODADDY) : 1,500
Straight of 6 : 1,500
Players need to reach 10,000 points to win.

name: Lootin' Wizards: Curses! Foiled Again
description:
After the death of the beloved Royal Mage of the kingdom, the king of the land set out a challenge to find his replacement. Wizards from far and wide came to vie for the position. Not all of them were kind and happy wizards, but the old royal mage made sure to leave some nasty tricks behind just for them. Traps and curses of all kinds were left strewn about his hiding places, now being plundered by the wizards seeking to replace him. Will they survive to claim the prize?

Lootin' Wizards: Curses! Foiled again is the first exciting expansion for the group card/board game where you race around trying to get more loot than your opponents. Now, not only can you make spells to battle each other, but curse them and their items to slow them down. This crazy expansion introduces a new character (the evil Alchemist Art), the ability to play with up to two more players in a game (up to 8 when used with the basic game), and a great mix of new Spell and Loot cards to add to the mix.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Lootin' Wizards: Quick Change
description:
After the death of the beloved Royal Mage of the kingdom, the king of the land set out a challenge to find his replacement. Wizards from far and wide came to vie for the position. Not all of them were kind and happy wizards, but the old royal mage made sure to leave some nasty tricks behind just for them. Traps and curses of all kinds were left strewn about his hiding places, now being plundered by the wizards seeking to replace him. Will they survive to claim the prize?

Lootin' Wizards: Quick Change is the second, and much anticipated, expansion for the group card/board game where you race around trying to get more loot than your opponents. Now, you can you make spells to actually alter the reality of the world your wizard is racing through. This crazy expansion introduces new Markers to place on the board (changing the very face of the map), the ability to play with up to two more players in a game (up to 8 when used with the basic game), and a great mix of new Spell and Loot cards to add to the mix.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Spila√∞u me√∞ okkur
description: A publicity product by the marketing / advertising agency Argus. Players roll a die and move their pawn along the track. If they land on pictures they draw the corresponding card and follow the instructions. The first one to the finish space wins.

name: My First Number Pairs
description:
My First Number Pairs is a matching game for preschoolers designed to help teach numbers. Pictures of numbers are matched with pictures of items in various multiples. For example, an 8 card would be matched to a card with a picture of eight butterflies.

Winner is the player who has collected the most pairs.

name: Pacific 1942 Cadet
description:
Pacific 1942 Cadet is a simplified version for beginners alias Cadets to play Pacific 1942 Admiral Game.
In Pacific 1942 Cadet you will acquire the basic skills that will both enable you to enjoy the game and prepare you for the crucible of the full version of the game.
Every Cadet aspiring to become an Admiral must be an expert in the movement of ships, aircraft and the marines; he or she must distinguish various types of weapons and be able to find the best solution to every situation.
Later on, you can move to Admiral full version. There is nothing in the rules for Cadets that would not apply to the full version, too. Only, as in life, also in Pacific 1942it is true that grey is the theory and green is the tree of life. So how does the full version differ?
The basic difference is represented by several slight modifications meant to make it more difficult to keep track of the opponent’s strength and intentions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, World War II

name: K√∂ly√∂k nyomoz√≥
description:
In this game players are junior detectives. They have to gather information about villains with magical powers.

There are 15 scenarios given for this game.

name: My First: What's My Job?
description: My First: What's My Job? is a children's educational game designed to help children associate objects with the jobs the people who use them and to help stimulate conversation. Game cards feature pictures of children acting out jobs such as Teacher, Fireman, and Singer as well as the objects they use. Players must match these cards together. For example, the fireman would match with the fire extinguisher, the singer would match with the microphone, and the teacher would match with the chalkboard. The player with the most matches is the winner.

name: Sitzkrieg
description:
Sitzkrieg is an expansion set for Axis and Allies which includes a new board sized 80 x 150 cm, an Excel based IPC-tracker, printable battleboards and a PDF based printable rules set.

The set comes without plastic figurines, so you need at least any of the Axis and Allies games with all major powers present or spare parts from Xeno Games to have enough figurines for all nations. The playable nations are: Germany, Italy, Japan, USSR, Chinese Communist Party (CCP) Kuomintang (KMT), France (Free & Vichy), Netherlands, neutrals and Britisch Commonwealth Nations divided into UK, Canada, South Africa, India and Australia.

The map offers you geographical features such as rivers and mountains that have their own influence on the units. When set up, the game starts with a couple of events that took place before 1939. You have to roll for the Second Sino-Japanese war and for the Spanish Civil War to start with. The Long March, The purge and the Winter War all take place in what is called turn zero.Starting turn 1 you may roll for nation specific technologies. Urban Warfare, Burma Road, Lend Lease, Convoys, International and Territorial Waters, Ports, Elite Infantry, Partisans, Spanish Blue Division, Political Leaders are elements that enhance the realistic feel of the game.

The goal is to win a bronze, silver or gold (historical) victory over your enemies.

Rules for which Axis and Allies and Xeno pieces can not be used:
-Weather effects like rain, heat, snow, fog and wind effect your troop's mobility. You can make your own weather markers or use the Litko Aerosystems weather markers.
-Oil Derricks (we recommend Petropolis pieces) and oil drums (we recommend the supply counters from Axis and Allies Battle of the Bulge)
-Commanders (we recommend 1/72 scale minis, Table Tactics jeeps or Axis and Allies miniatures commanders) Commanders allow surrender or retreat options.
-Elite Infantry (we recommend 1/72 scale minis or AA Miniatures

To get all the miniatures to play all the rules is a bit of work, but remember you can also use them to make house rules for your regular Axis and Allies games or use the Sitzkrieg rules as an expansion to your own games.
categories: Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Grand Prix Jumping
description:
In Grand Prix Jumping the players take on the roles of riders leading their steeds through a Grand Prix competition course which includes fences of varying rail heights, as well as a water jump. Getting through the course fast will help your cause but will not guarantee victory as the winner is not the horse that finishes fastest but the one with fewest fault points.

You design the course before each game so the strategy will change with each play. You can make the course as demanding as you want. While Grand Prix Jumping is at its heart a card game, there is very little luck involved and the better skilled rider will be victorious.

name: Jetzt geht's los, Kleiner Rabe
description:
There are 32 cards devided in 8 groups of 4 cards. With these cards the players can play 5 different games.

Alle Viere: Every player gets four cards in theis hands. The other cards are placed in the middle of the table. The game is played like 'Go Fish.'

Gleich und Gleich: Starting with the youngest. The cards are placed face down on the table. each player tries to find the same kind of cards. Played like Memory.

Eins, Zwei, Drei: The deck is shuffled and every player gets 6 cards. The other cards are placed on the table. In a players turn he/she gets a card and discards a card. The object of the game is to collect 3 or 4 cards of the same kind.

Aufgepaßt: This game is all about 'reaction'. every player gets a deck of cards. Simutaneously the players turn their first card face up. The players who have the same picture, tries to place their hand on the other player card. The first player who gets the card wins both cards.

Angeschmiert: All the cards but one are shuffled and devided among the players. At the players turn, he/she takes a card from an another player. When the player collects a pair, its placed open on the table.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: √âretts√©giz≈ë honfoglal√≥ t√°rsasj√°t√©k
description:
Special edition of the game Honfoglaló, where players can conquer areas (counties of Hungary) by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) But also you have to choose a good strategy in order to conquer the whole country.

In this special edition there are 2160 new questions, which help to prepare to the final exam at the end of the high school in Hungary.

name: √ç sk√≥inn
description: A single track game that is included with the album Í skóinn by the designer. Players roll and move their pawns (not included) and follow the instructions if needed. The first one to the finish space wins the game.

name: Blue the Grey & the Butternut
description:
Excerpt from the book:

"The main and only aim of these rules is to allow a few people to get together and quickly set up a table, play a large game in an evening or an all day game on the weekend, have fun, have realistic results and achieve those results and also know who has won."

User summary:

This is a set of miniatures rules for corps-army level actions, where each player takes on the role of corps commander.

Scale:
Ground scale: 1" = 100 yds.
Time scale: 10 min/turn
Stands: base represents a demi-brigade (approximately 500-1000 men), base sizes are 3-4" wide by 1.5-2" deep.
Figure scale: there is no required figure scale or number of figure/base requirement

name: Nyelvtanul√≥k t√°rsasj√°t√©ka
description:
Special edition of the game Honfoglaló, where players, divided into three teams can conquer areas by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) But also you have to choose a good strategy in order to conquer everything.

The aim of this special edition is to help learn the English or German language. The areas are parts of Germany or England, and the questions are about the German and English language on three different levels: beginner, intermediate or upper-intermediate.

name: Olympia Gold
description: "Olympia Gold" is a world class Equestrian Board Game that depicts real life thrills and excitement of Dressage, Cross Country, and Stadium Jumping competition throughout the world. The winner is determined by the person or team to accumulate the most points, controlling the unified player and getting to the gold first. Play Olympia Gold in sequences, Dressage first, continuing on to Cross Country, and finally Stadium, totaling your score for all three just like in real life, or play Olympia Gold simultaneously, all three disciplines at the same time, as individuals or teams.

name: Three to Match
description:
Three to Match is an educational children's game. Each player is given a board with several picture combinations on it in sets of three. There are ten squares on the board, each of which contains three images, a tree, a bird, and a tea kettle. A block may contain any combination of the images, for example, two birds and a tree. Players also have a stack of cards with the images on them.

Players roll dice containing the images and then chose a card that has the images rolled and place it on the corresponding place on their board (the image on the board and the card should be the same). The winner is the first player to fill all ten spots on their board.

name: Lift
description: This game is played on a 6x6 grid. One player puts 36 balls into the grid (3x12 of the same color). The pattern must be symmetric. Afterwards he/she covers the balls with 36 "lids". The other players now take turns lifting individual lids and checking the color. When a player thinks he or she knows the entire pattern, he or she makes a sketch on a piece of paper. After a number of rounds, the player with least errors wins.

name: Mahlzeit
description: Simple roll and move game in which dogs try to get to bowls of dog food and bring them home. Afterwards they can turn them around. If the color of the bowl matches that of the dog that dog has won. If not, the dog has to start over.

name: Onkel Doktor
description: The players are doctors examining a patient. One illness is randomly chosen and hidden in a pouch. The players move "medical" items (stethoscope, thermometer etc.) around a board by rolling dice. When an item reaches a field with a matching symbol, the player can check a symptom from the pouch. In the course of the game, players gather more and more information until someone makes a correct guess about the disease.

name: Total verr√ºcktes Pferderennen
description: Simple dice rolling game for the very young. Wooden horse figures are placed on the starting field of a circular track. Players then take turn rolling a color die. The horse of the color shown moves forward by one field. The first horse reaching the finish line (16 fields onwards) is the winner.

name: So ein Affentheater
description: Players roll and move their monkeys through the jungle. On some squares they can use a catapult and try to fling a monkey into a tree. The first player to get all three monkeys into the tree is the winner.

name: A Game of Inches
description: The object it to get the cards to add up to 2 inches or come as close as possible without going over 2 inches.

name: Sport Quiz
description: Simple roll and move game with one twist: on some place of the board the players have to answer trivia questions about the Olympics or world championships. 500 questions in Hungarian are included.

name: ≈êseink nyom√°ban
description:
In this game players start with a secret mission to conquer certain areas (counties of the medieval Hungary). When a territory is attacked, a type of question is randomly chosen. A third player describes a phrase verbal, pantomimic or by drawing, or asks a trivia question about history, art or science. The first of the two opponents to answer wins the battle. The first player who conquers all the areas on his/her mission card wins the game.

Expansion: ≈êseink nyom√°ban p√≥tk√©rd√©sek 10 √©ves kort√≥l

name: B.J.U.opoly
description:
This is a monopoly style game about Bob Jones University.

"Temporary cuts from the pain of too much studying."

Includes game board, 4 pawns, play money, 2 dice, Credit tokens, Diploma tokens, Collegian cards, Campus Mail cards, deed cards, and instructions.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: R.I.D.E.
description:
"R.I.D.E. stands for Reduce Impaired Drivers Everywhere"

This is an educational game about traffic safety and the dangers of drinking and driving. It features six adjustable dials that the players use to monitor their blood alcohol level.

R.I.D.E. also includes a colorful board, 6 pawns, a die, question cards, rules, and a storage insert.

name: Squares
description: Two players move across a simple game board, trying to reach the starting line of the other player and therefore win the game. In each turn, one playing piece (chip) can be moved forward one field. By building majorities on a given line, the other player can be forced to equalize or retreat from his/her position. If that is not possible, the front chip has to be removed.

name: Capitaly 2000: Sopron
description: This is a regional version of Capitaly (the Hungarian clone of Monopoly). The properties are from the city Sopron, the currency is, strangely, euro.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Capitaly 2000: Gy≈ër
description: This is a regional version of Capitaly (the Hungarian clone of Monopoly). The properties are from the city Gy≈ër, the currency is, strangely, euro.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Super-Match
description: Abstract strategy for two. Each player has six pawns which are placed on the outer rim of the game board. Each move consists of moving one pawn one field in any direction. If a pawn gets stuck between two opposing pawns, it is removed. The first player that is reduced to one pawn is the loser.

name: Tante Klara packt den Koffer und...
description: Variation of the (German?) classic game "Kofferpacken". There are 108 item cards. The starting player announces that aunt Klara packs her suitcase and takes item X (puts tile on the table). The next player puts another tile on top, announcing that aunt Klara packs item X and item Y. Continue until somebody cannot repeat the entire list of things stacked up. That player has to take all stacked tiles. The first player to run out of tiles is the winner.

name: Teichspiel
description:
Cooperative game about protecting wildlife in little ponds. Each player has a pond and tries to fill it with different animals (frogs, dragonflies, etc.). There is a special die showing which animal to put into one's pond, but it also has a digger side. If a player rolls this symbol, a piece is added to a digger puzzle. For the neutral clover leaf side, one can put an environmentalist (pawn) in front of the digger. If eight protesters are in front of the digger before it is completed, the first player to fill up his/her pond with eight animals, wins. Otherwise, everybody loses.

Only two of each animal can be in a pond. A player who rolls an animal that is already in his/her pond twice, has to "donate" the roll to another player.

name: Wie sp√§t ist es?
description: A game in which children can learn to read the clock. One player draws a tile and reads out the time printed on it. The other players have to be the first to adjust their large clocks to the time announced, so they can get the tile. The first player to get 12 tiles is the winner.

name: W√ºrfel-Roulette
description: Roulette variant in which the results are determined by four dice. The maximum profit is 210 times the ante.

name: Just Add Friends: We Supply the Rest ‚Äì Mexican Fiesta Version
description:
This game is an interactive party game for friends and family.

The game is simply spelling with a few added twists. As players make their way around the "Sombrero", points are awarded for spelling any word and bonus points for spelling words associated with a Mexican Fiesta.

Learn about an annual bi-cultural festival, authentic Mexican costumes & how to prepare delicious Mexican cuisine.

name: USMK (Ultimate Street-Fight Mortality Kombat)
description:
USMK is a fast action card and dice game that depicts famous characters battling to the death!

FAMOUS FIGHTERS
Fighters from comics, movies, and video games clash in this fight to the finish!!

Each FIGHTER CARD contains...

-20 offensive maneuvers depicting how much damage it does and where it does it
- 2 super moves. Fighters much charge up their special moves by doing damage to his opponent. Once they are charged up, look out. These moves usually tare off limbs or decapitate the opposition.

ARENA CHARTS

-Toss your opponent through a window!! Slam him into a car!! If you are super strong fling him into a nearby billboard.

- Fights start off in the streets. As the battle progresses you could be knocked through a wall and wind up fighting it out inside a building.


USMK is designed as a distraction game. It plays fast and furious and is meant to be played as a solo experience. There is no strategy. Just roll the dice and watch the two warriors tear into each other.

name: Net Worth
description:
Net Worth is a financial game that attempts to teach budgeting principles by recreating a typical family economic situation. Players have a monthly budget that includes insurance, expenses, income, savings, and stock speculation.

Monthly income is determined by the job that each player receives at the beginning of the game and by investments that pay dividends or interest each month. Expenses are both fixed (for insurance, etc) and determined by random card draw. For example, a card may say, "You have a child go to college, pay $50 a month for the next 16 months." Players are also allowed to take loans, which of course increases monthly expenses.

The game ends after 24 months. The player with the highest Net Worth is the winner. Any player who's debts cannot be paid off is considered bankrupt and has lost.

There does not appear to be a maximum to how many people can play the game.

name: EdLee: A Game of Self-Concept
description:
EdLee - A Game of Self-Concept is a children's game designed to help players express positive attributes about themselves. The game is played on a Bingo like board with letters filled in on certain squares that say things like, "I am Loving," "I am Intelligent," or "I am Delightful." The group leader randomly chooses tiles with letter-number combinations that players then mark off on their card. When a player covers all the letters of their phrase, they must tell an example about how they are loving, delightful, etc. The group leader should encourage players to give very detailed examples and reinforce them with positive statements like, "I think you are loving because you are always kind to me." All of the players can win once their card is filled in and they have told their story.

The game supports up to 25 players (for a classroom setting).

name: Arctic Meltdown: 2 Player Mini Version
description:
Toward the end of this century, Mankind will push north to the melting ice and the last of the recoverable crude. Each round, opponents take turns co-ordinating multiple units of varying ability (orders are placed and carried out), with the purpose of controlling as much battlefield as possible before the Arctic Oil Reserve runs dry.

There’s eight rounds-of-play and various ways to maximise Victory Points. Game duration falls between thirty and fifty minutes, depending on experience, with rules of around 1100 words. This is a 2-Player mini-version of a well-tested 4-Player game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy's Question and Answer Game
description:
An old Trivia game based on the children televisionseries Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy.
The cards are printed on both sides. One Question side and one answer side.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: ≈êseink nyom√°ban p√≥tk√©rd√©sek 10 √©ves kort√≥l
description:
224 additional cards for the boardgame ≈êseink nyom√°ban, where you conquer areas by answering trivia questions or finding out what another player describes verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This expansion is for children at the age of 10 and up.

Expansion for: ≈êseink nyom√°ban
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia, Wargame

name: The Shell Game
description:
The Ageless Challenge - Is the Hand Quicker than the Eye?

A simple game where everyone gets to try their hand at shuffling the shells. Correct guesses earn the guesser the right to place markers on one of the color scoring cards. Incorrect guesses mean the dealer/mixer gets to score. The score cards are relatively Bingo-esque and you can place your tokens to win or to block.

name: Who is the King of the Animals
description:
Lion's position in the jungle is not so steady anymore. There are enough competitors out here for him. Check it out who is the best canditate to be the king in the jungle.

The are 2 in 1:
In boardgame players play the cards for placing the tiles on the board adjestant to their already played tiles. Game ends immediately if there is no empty squares with animal-tiles on the board or any player places his last tile on the board.
Player multiply the number of his dominating animals and sum the results.
The player who has the most points is the winner .

Cardgame is fun and quick filler for 2-4 players. There are 7 animals and on every card different animals are greater or less than another animals.
Players may place cards on top of any stacks on table if played card is greater than last card in this stack. Game ends if any player places his last card on any stack or draw deck has exhausted.

Components:

a board
56 tiles in 4 colors
42 cards + 10 bonus cards for cardgame variant
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Die Grabr√§uber
description: Each player has a village with pyramids. The goal is to destroy the other villages' pyramids and to protect the own village. The game is dice-driven and luck-based.

name: Dromos
description: The game board depicts a world map. Each player receives several "runners" and starts in a continent (or two, depending on the number of players). The runners can hold up to five wooden pearls, each pearl color representing a continent. A runner can move 1-6 squares, depending on the number of pearls it holds. The more, the slower. The runners try to pick up pearls from each continent (by moving there); they can lose pearls and start over by being jumped over by another runner. The first player to return to his/her home continent(s) with all runners, each runner holding five colors of pearls, is the winner.

name: Gobble-up
description: The game board is a 9x9 grid. 48 wooden discs are laid out (on all fields except the outer rim and the center). A player's move consists of first moving one disc one field orthogonally, then jumping over any neighboring disc with any disc (there are no player colors; all pieces may be used). Chain jumps are ok, and all discs that a player jumps over are removed and counted towards the 25 victory points that are the winning condition.

name: The Sassy Experience Game
description:
The game is all about you ... and your friends! You'll get to say what you think! Are you SASSY enough to share your secrets?

Object: To be SASSY by being the first player to win one each of 6 awards - Awareness, Brains, Confidence, Love, Sensitivity, Talent.

The Dice: Roll both, one decides the category you'll read on the Sassy Card, the other decides your choices on your turn (Play, Play/Pass, Bummer)

Use your choice maker to determine which category - Features, Quiz, and People in Your Life

Use your Sassy/Not Sassy Voting Card for these categories - Help, Stuff You Do, and It Happened to Me

name: whatever, you moron.
description:
It's Happy Bunny and... It's a game! Or at least, that's what the box says.

Gameplay consists of a movement across a board by way of a spinner and drawing cards from one of six categories: Truth Cards, Dare Cards, Hang Bunny Cards, Ring The Bunny Cards, Skull Cards or Whatever, You Moron Cards.

Includes:
Spinner Game Board
80 Game Cards
4 It's Happy Bunny Pawns and Stands
40 Small Rings
One Large Ring

name: Richard the Lionheart
description:
From the publisher:

Richard the Lionheart is a medieval man-to-man skirmish game that recreates the crusades with all their diversity of warriors, tactics, and leadership. Using a step by step scenario system that gradually introduces you to the rules, you will soon be fighting encounters between Muslim and Christian in the Holy Land. Whether you are fighting to allow baggage train through or simulating a battle Richard the Lionheart and Saladin and their bodyguard troops this game allows the cavalry and infantry tactics of the period to be accurately portrayed and resolved.

With 6 full color geomorphic map boards, hundreds of counters of different troop types from the noble Hospitilar knights to Bedouin tribesmen, colour cut-out village card and other components, this game is not so much a board game but more a history kit for the serious gamer.

name: K√§ferkrabbelei
description: 48 beetles are placed in an electric bed. When this is switched on, the beetles jump up and down and the players have to "catch" them with tweezers. When a beetle jumps out of the bed, it is out of the game, too. The player who can catch most beetles is the winner.

name: Mein gro√ües Gesundheits-Spiel
description:
The players move around a Monopoly-style board. On certain fields, they have to perform certain actions, such as drawing a card (containing additional actions), for example.
